description: Yelp is very much on a relative scale and in terms of a fun dive bar, this place is one of the best. The drinks were reasonably priced, the crowd was fun, friendly and there to have a good time. We particularly enjoyed the "obamarama" shot which is a vodka cranberry shot that is dangerous because it is decently strong and tastes amazing. The service was very friendly. My colleague spilled his beer and the bartender refilled it and didn't charge us for the extra.
author: Sharvari J.

description: I was in the bathroom with my friend and a girl came in and was upset that I asked her to step out of the bathroom to wait her turn because the door doesn't lock! And she slapped the crap out of my face, and no one kicked her out but they asked me to leave because "I pushed her out of the bathroom" I'm writing this as my face still hurts but no one kicked her out. This is why I don't go to white trash bars. If you like white trash this is the place to be. The bar staff is great though.
author: Erica L.

description:
This place is awesome.  We found it on our walk to Fisherman's Wharf.  It was quiet cuz it was a Monday afternoon.  Fleet Week was in progress so among us, and two locals, was a few Navy personnel.  The bartender was very attentive and fun to talk to.  We had a beer...nothing special.  Place has been around for a long time. It is, in fact, NOT  a diner any longer.  

We would go back again.
author: KT T.

description: BUFFALO BILLS MAFIA UNITE!  Look no further, this is THE Buffalo Bills Bar of San Francisco.  Celebrate the wins, the losses, your hangover, your marriage, your divorce, your pregnancy (well, maybe not)...what I'm trying to say is, it's PERFECT FOR EVERY OCCASION (but especially a Buffalo Bills game).
author: Natalie L.

description:
Cozy little bar in a yellow building on the corner that has good happy hour deals along with free popcorn and pool. Bar that has a lot of TVs around so great for watching games. 5 dollar drafts. 

Eavesdropped and heard it's the true Bill's bar of San Francisco.

Also free popcorn and pool - great place for after work. 

Shoutout my trainer Tom who recommended to me
author: Bito M.

description: Awesome sports bar, great locals and had some chat with the saucy blonde behind the bar. I'll be back.
author: Nick L.

description: Talk about cool vibes! This little neighborhood bar is so much fun! I first stopped in here during SF Beer Week and it was probably my favorite spot on the pub crawl. The music playing in this lovely bar was the best mix of 70's and 80's hits and made our time spent here even more fun! We managed to order quite a few of your standard bar drinks : vodka sodas, whiskey gingers, etc., and all of them were well made and on-point. No watered down drinks here! A couple of added bonuses that make this place extra amazing are their popcorn offerings, pool table, and dog friendly attitude. I am all about a laid-back, friendly, fun, welcoming space and Northstar really does have it all! Kudos to the bartenders for their quick service and attentiveness. The only teensie, tiny (no pun intended) detail that I might mention wasn't so up-to-par was their miniature restrooms. Somehow they managed to squeeze a washroom into the tiniest of spaces and somehow, people have figured out a way to utilize it when in dire straits! I, myself had to squeeze into the restroom to relieve myself and let me tell you...it was no easy feat! While the restroom is the least of my concerns when visiting an establishment, I do appreciate a regular sized one that doesn't make me feel like a circus freak, or incredibly claustrophobic. That being said, I still give this place 5 stars for winning in every other category!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Having a blast watching the Bills game with fellow Buffalo Bills lovers!! Bloody Mary's are perfect for the 10am start!!
author: Nancy B.

description: Went here for bar hopping on Saint Patrick's Day and it was pretty happening here. There was a line outside, once you get in there was no space, but it was crowded, lots of people, green beer and a great atmosphere. Probably just a regular bar on a regular day though with sports television. Nothing special. Friendly bartenders, though!
author: Marie D.

description: Stopped in twice because these place is an authentic San Francisco neighborhood bar. Friendly patrons and Cassie gave us the off the beaten path advice on where to go. Will return every time I am in  San Francisco
author: Jon A.

description: Won't be going back.  Men's room has a picture of Weinstein and Woody Allen laughing it up with a captain that reads, "ok Woody, you're turn."  Pretty disgusting if you ask me.  I asked the bartender what the deal was and he quickly said- "listen if you don't like it then you can get out."  Very classy
author: Joey E.

description: My favorite place in the city to watch sports.  I am in the neighborhood and a Navy alum so am often there.  Saturday the bar hosts Navy, LSU, and U of Washington alumni for their respective football games.  Don't miss the popcorn in the corner!
author: Ben M.

description: Great drinks, reasonable prices and Cass the bartender is AWESOME!!!!
author: mary f.

description: Another typical neighborhood bar. Went during a Warriors game on a Saturday afternoon while a beer pong tournament raged on in the other room, which made me feel super old. It was very crowded, so fiance and I stood with our drinks, which was fine. The bartenders were quick, attentive, and friendly. A bustling atmosphere.
author: Christina S.

description: Great atmosphere , opens early for football, a great break from the city..highly recommend . an we will be coming back
author: Larry K.

description:
This place does what is says on the can! Awesome staff, reasonably priced drinks and a great atmosphere. Best beer selection in the neighborhood and without any BS.
Always throwing party's or special events to keep us smiling, drinking and generally feeling appreciated!  Cheers Northstar!
author: Nick S.

description: I found Northstar 3 years ago and it has become my home away from home ever since.   The entire experience here is warm, friendly and spirited.  The service is  awesome and I am counting the days til I can have another shot & beer!
author: John M.

description:
Free pool and free popcorn, and 2 blocks from my house.

Definitely a neighborhood bar, a few blocks from Grant Ave.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Many thanks to Mark and the staff for hosting our #GingerStrong fundraiser in late January. I definitely suggest you using Northstar Café to host a\your fundraiser of choice. We set it up the fundraiser so that if you paid $10 at the door you got a wristband and extended happy hour pricing. We also had a special shot that we received 90% of the proceeds from. We made over $600 from the donations at the door, and just over $200 from the #GinngerStrong shot, totaling over $800 raised. 

We could not have done it without your support, and the support of your great team. We look forward to hosting another fundraiser next year, and we will certainly see you in the fall for what is shaping up to be an exciting Bills' season!
author: W. Daniel C.

description:
My favorite local bar! Free pool. The bartenders are awesome. 

On Wednesdays, they host bar crawls, so you can meet tons foreigners. 

Highly recommend this bar to anyone.
author: Taylor H.

description:
After years as a regular, I'm finally writing a review. This place has definitely changed as the city developed. I starting coming to this bar when I turned 21. 6 years later, I'm still loving it. First off, the bartenders are amazing. All of them are super friendly and are very genuine people. 

This dive bar tends to have a lot of regulars. Many of them live in the neighborhood and many of them are from Italy. During the week, pool is free. They also serve free popcorn if you ask. Drinks are cheap and service is quick. 

I've noticed throughout the years that more "bros" are hanging out at this bar, specifically on the weekends. It tends to get suuuuuper busy on the weekends, so be prepared if you don't like crowded areas. I tend to just come on Sundays or during the week.

Their bathroom is tiny, one stall of guys and one for girls, but honestly, I've never had to wait long to use the restroom, and it's kept relatively clean considering how crowded it can get. 

Even though I no longer live in the city, I try to drop by whenever I'm back. 

Overall, if you want a chill dive bar to hang out at with some awesome, down to earth bartenders, come here!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
It's a Buffalo Bills bar and my bf is obsessed with the Bills... Otherwise, I probably would have never even set foot in here. Let's be honest, there's tons of bars in SF and tons of chills bars in North Beach alone!

This place does get props for allowing us to do a fundraiser for our Cycle for Survival team, though. We were able to have a special shot where 90% of the cost benefited our cause and we sold wrist bands that gave the customers happy hour prices!

Your spacious spot, cool staff, and clean bathrooms make me a fan. As for the Bills? It'll take a lot more for me to turn my back on my Niners.

Note: $15 credit card minimum.
author: Leana L.

description:
'Twas my first visit, a rendezvous point before another progressive meal through San Francisco. Not bad even though a theme bar and cousin to Shanghai Kelly's at Broadway and Polk Streets. The staff were very welcoming and patrons - even the one puppy - seemed to be having a lovely time if it.

My now typical order was a double shot of Bushmills with a lager or ale chaser and that was tasty and served well.

One could do a lot worse.
author: Jay D.

description: Divey af. This was actually one of the first few bars I went to when I turned 21 and it was not really my scene so there's my disclaimer right there. I came on a Friday night for a friend's birthday party. Our group basically crowded out the back room and we played pool and talked and hung out. I dunno. I don't really have much to say. I'm not really a dive bar type of person, the drinks were okay but nothing spectacular, the place was pretty grimey in my opinion, and all in all, it just wasn't that memorable of an experience.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
My friend and I were on our way back to the police station garage (which isn't badly priced), and decided to grab a pint here. This is a solid dive bar on the edge of Chinatown with a friendly, local atmosphere. I definitely feel like I've been to similar in New York and elsewhere in the city.

The bar had a decent selection of California craft beers, a Jager and Fireball machine, and some solid Scotch selections. Plenty of TVs were playing the Giants and the Golf game, and the awesome British bartender was providing hilarious color commentary. Actually coming on a lazy Sunday to hear this guy in a cup match would be worth the trip alone.

Sadly we only came in for a pint, but looking around they definitely favor their patrons - along the walls are "Customer of the Month" signs, which is a great touch.
author: Michael C.

description:
This place is awesome on Sundays during the NFL season. The front of the bar is represented by Buffalo Bills fans and the back is represented by the Philadelphia Eagles. I'm an Eagles fan and somehow this works. Everyone there is polite and relaxed. 

Drinks are cheap? Check. The bartenders are cool, normal and serve you in a timely manner. It's everything you want in a 'dive' bar. It's a cool, incognito spot in a touristy area. There is no food but they occasionally do something on the weekend but it really doesn't matter because there are a ton of places in the area to grab a bite. 

If you are a Bills fan or an Eagles fan I think you should definitely go there. Think the Kezar Pub without the prices or shitty beer (or service). It's a North Beach bar without the annoying bro's (didn't mean to offend anyone). There is always a friendly, laid back, knowledgeable sports crowd there. They have a pool table in the back. 

If you want to just kick, watch sports, shoot darts or play pool in a relax atmosphere with cheap drinks - go here.
author: Sean D.

description:
If you're lookin' for a good dive bar, congrats you've found it!

Cheap beer and shots, FREE POOL & POPCORN. 

Pool was fun but gave me a splinter, and the special shot of the night tasted "just like gatorade frost" said our Florida friend. Buut the price don't lie and it was super cheap, bathrooms clean and didn't smell bad :D

Bartenders were on point, 5 stars for them and the popcorn was just right for all the PBR we were crushing.

Go for the free pool and to meet a ton of cool folks, yes they are waiting for the pool table too but that's ok, that's how you make friends, or enemies, no judging.
author: Mira T.

description:
Stopped by Friday night at 6:45. It was at 80% capacity, but still plenty of room to walk, stretch, perfect. Really cool vibe here, friendly neighborhood bar. Non-douchey, non-pretentious, chill. Bartender was awesome, she is your friend right from the get-go. Bar crowd is friendly too, doesn't get too loud that you have to yell, was able to converse with a nice gal two barstools over.

Happy hour Mon-Fri ends at 7, with $3 wells and drafts, and free popcorn. That popcorn wasn't just stale stuff from a large carnival bag either, it was on par with fresh theater popcorn with a hint of butter, popped in an actual machine right by the door. 

Wish I lived or worked nearby, honestly. This bar certainly has that potential for a HIMYM meetup. Can't wait to stop by on a Sunday to check out the football crowd!
author: Ethan L.

description: Aweosme atmosphere and very friendly bartenders even when you come alone. Particularly the Irish guy! The nicest and most genuine bartender I have met in the USA.
author: Oli M.

description: First time in SF for a wedding 11/12/16 and somehow ended up at this establishment later in the night. Very impressed with the bouncer and the way he handled a situation. Basically there was some drunk smaller guy sitting at the bar who started talking a bunch of smack to me. I'm almost 6'5" and a meaty 285lbs so I'd likely wipe the floor with him. Anyway he kept popping off and the bouncer (dude with sweet staché) somehow must've heard him and came over to me. I told him the situation as I just walked in and hadn't been there more than 30 seconds and he immediately took care of the guy. I'm not sure if he kicked him out, knew him or just called a cab but when I came out of the bathroom he was gone. Definitely a very positive atmosphere and A+ to the bouncer.
author: Jeremiah O.

description:
Love the North Star.

I visited San Fran this week, and after three hours of wandering around on Monday, I was in need of a seat and a drink.  All the happy hours started at 4 or 5... my watch said 2pm but my easy coast body knew it was time to get my drink on.  Well, when I passed by this place and saw the sign for a 1-7pm happy hour, I knew I was home.

When I sat down, the other patron Mike (a fisherman from WA who loves hanging out here when in SF) and bartender Molly immediately started chatting me up.  I enjoyed a beer and an Irish coffee over the next hour or so, and got some yummy hot popcorn once Molly got the machine going.

The drinks are so reasonably priced (cheap even, by my NYC standards), and still yummy and boozy.  I know this is known as a dive bar, but really it just seemed relaxed, open, cheery, and friendly.  While I was there (Monday afternoon), the pace was slow, but I can see how it'd fill up on a weekend evening.

When I told Mike + Molly that I'd just landed in San Francisco a couple of hours before, they said, "You just got here and it didn't take you long to find the North Star."  

*giggle.*
author: Dione D.

description:
I don't know why this place is called a "cafe." As for as I can tell, it's a BAR! And a great one, at that. It's a classic dive bar with friendly bartenders, cheap drinks and a phenomenal happy hour that goes from 1-7pm. 
We spent a very memorable afternoon/evening here... it's just a shame I can't remember more of it.
author: Charles S.

description:
5 Reason's why I like Northstar Cafe:

1. One of the bartenders here is AMAZING. So nice. Remembers names and faces of you and your friends. Cheers you on while you play pool. Why can't more bartenders be this friendly??

2. Saw a guy with a dog here. More dogs should go to bars. AKA more owners should bring their dogs to bars. I like dogs.

3. Learned what an Irish Drinking Cow is. Apparently if you carry around a Irish Drinking Cow, you (and anyone else the drinking cow blesses) will be hangover free the next morning. It worked. I felt amazing the next morning. Plus it's an awesome drinking game where you can throw a cow on the ground.

4. Saw a guy carrying around a bottle of wine. I don't know why I like this, but I do.

5. Co-Dominated the pool table with a friend for 4 rounds of pool. We both suck at pool, but something about the Northstar Cafe environment made us awesome.

Anyways, come here for drinks at night. Great, not overly crowded, environment where you can catch up with friends.
author: Michelle L.

description: This is the Sunday spot where you can enjoy a crisp, cold wobbly pop in good company.  Sub at the bar is the man.  There is free popcorn and pool.
author: Paul L.

description:
Pros: Chill dive bar
Cons: Starts to get crowded as the night progresses

Stopped by here with some friends during my last trip to SF. Located in North Beach, it's a pretty chill dive bar. Not too big, but there's a couple of tables in the back. Drinks here are reasonable (about $7). There's a pool table in the back too.

We got here kinda early on a Saturday, but as the night went on it started to get obnoxiously crowded.

Other than that, cool spot.
author: Justin B.

description:
I heard this was the Buffalo Bills bar in San Francisco, and I was not disappointed.  It was a great place to watch a game filled with quite a few foolish Bills fans.  

The drinks were reasonably priced.  There was a drink with Sweet Tea Vodka and Lemonade that was too amazing; I had to stop after two or my day would have been short.   The beer selection was solid, and I know all the Western New Yorkers enjoyed having Labatt Blue on hand to watch their Bills.

If "nice dive bar" is a type of bar you enjoy or if you are a Buffalo Bills fan in San Francisco, you have to go Northstar.
author: Michael B.

description:
Friendly relaxed atmosphere- good place to watch sports......
Ok walking by and it looked inviting after a long day if walking , but pleasantly surprised.
author: Diana L.

description:
I have been living in the city for 5 months now and it has become one of my favorite bars. The drinks are inexpensive and the bar tenders are awesome...AND THE POPCORN IS FREE!

It's a great place to watch college and nfl football on the weekends...
author: David P.

description: It's the Buffalo Bills bar! How can it not be full of fun!? Great place to watch a game. They have pool in the back and plenty TVs. In the morning, they have breakfast burritos outside. A couple years ago, we took a bus from here to Candlestick for a Bills vs 49ers game. It was so much fun even with the sad trip back. (Bills got KILLED by the 49ers) This place is super casual and has a good mix of people.
author: Gina R.

description:
What a great way to end Tony C,'s fantastical pub crawl. We showed up around 10:45 and were greeted with a full house of awesomely friendly patrons who were just as drunk as I was. It was great.

I had a couple of well made cocktails and a beer, and all were served by the energetic bartenders with great skills behind the bar.

I love this place and can't wait to return whether its due to watching sports or from an all night drunk.
author: Justin C.

description: In San Francisco for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Planned a night to go see Beach Blanket Babylon. Had some time to spare. Stepped in to Northstar Cafe, really a bar. Was pleasantly greeted by the best personable service by (Ryan?). Cool place with great service. Beer was cold. Great atmosphere....will definitely recommend and be back from Phoenix.
author: Gia P.

description:
Hi, Northstar. I miss you- but guess what? PBR is $3 or less in Michigan, too! However, nothing can replace the wonderful bartenders, the pool crew, the regulars, or the fact Steve gave me a Snuggie.
 
What I find hard to believe is that I am still the Dutchess of Northstar, and I haven't been in San Francisco since June! Awesome.

"Voted #1 Happy Hour by The Betty Ford Clinic"

Totally worth coming here, even if it's for the free popcorn and a smile.
author: Kristin F.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar. The bartenders are all friendly, they offer free popcorn, the drinks are very affordable, and best of all, they play the LSU football games during the fall season! They are strictly a bar - so there is no kitchen, but during football season, they sell Louisiana style cajun food out of big soup kitchen containers. I think the food is prepared off-site so it is cash only. A nice touch!
author: Kelsey K.

description:
This place was awesome. Total dive bar but totally awesome, chill atmosphere.

My coworkers and I stopped in here for a quick drink whilst waiting for our table at the infamous Tony's Pizza - the bartender quickly picked up that we were out-of-towners and made us welcome, and we had some good, light conversation with him. It was a rather refreshing surprise, especially from a bartender!

The drinks were well-priced and everyone who was at the bar seemed to be enjoying themselves greatly. Lots of TVs and a pool table, so enough things to please everyone!

We didn't stay long but we enjoyed our time here. This would be one of those places I would seek out again, next time I'm in SF. Thanks Northstar!
author: Sam S.

description:
We came here for the SDSU game because Shanghai Kelly's is always packed! I cannot say a bad thing about this place! 

When we first got there most of the tables/bar stools were taken so we went into the back by the pool area which was fine. However, the owner came up to me and told me the game sound was going to be on in the front not the back. When I told him there were no seats left in the front for our party of 6, he left, came back and found us a table, gave us stools and put us in prime spot to watch the game! On top of that, he provided us with some snackified popcorn! He also took some complimentary shots with us :).  Such a nice guy!

The bartender was so nice and attentive. She knew exactly which group I was with and always got me a drink when I was out. 

Seriously the best customer service I have ever received at a packed bar. On point.
author: Jordan S.

description:
This dive pretty much defines what a dive is, and shall always be. The drinks flow fast, strong, and cheap. It's small, crowded, and fun. The crowd is a smattering of all types from the area. 
There is one free pool table in the back... If you see me there, let's play for shots!
author: Dave W.

description:
FREE POOL AND POPCORN!!
(4 stars)

Although the popcorn was kind of stale, it was still addicting to keep munching on. This was the meet up spot before the Elite Yelpers started the Drink & Hunt SF game through North Beach. The location was a bit off the side from the main bars, which was kind of nice. Drinks are dirty cheap for HH and if you were an elite yelper that evening, drinks were extra cheaper. 

The venue was small, bartenders were friendly and always there to fill your glass up, TVs around to watch football, and the back area has a pool table. The place is kind of dark but i guess its good to taint the attractiveness of people around you! ha!

Will I be back? I'd actually can see myself grabing a drink or two here on a random day.
author: Jane A.

description:
The sign outside says it all.......

Happy Hour
Monday thru Friday 
1p.m. - 7p.m

$3 all pints and well drinks

FREE pool and popcorn

Voted #1 Happy Hour by  The Betty Ford Clinic
author: Ed V.

description:
I was researching where the Bills Backers of San Francisco meet and that's how I found the Northstar Cafe.  I arrived early enough to get a seat at the bar and was glad I did as it filled up fast.  

This place is fairly small with a room off the bar that has booth seating, a pool table and additional TVs.  

The bartenders were efficient and friendly.  The popcorn was a bonus!  Loved the retro cash register and old school charge card machine used.  It's been awhile since I've signed off on a duplicate inked charge slip.  Lots of cool memorabilia and sports banners serve as decor.  

The patrons were friendly and overall I thought this was a cool bar.  Based on the many reviews, it's a great place for happy hour - maybe next time.
author: Alayne H.

description:
I have a weakness for a good dive bar... I'm not sure exactly what it is but I love a night out watching sports and chatting in a San Fran dive bar better than most other activities... and I'm pretty girly & non-divey when it comes to most of my life!

A friend recommended this place as a good venue for watching games and possibly being able to tune into big matches from home (I'm Australian - it's really hard to find bars willing to show sport from that side of the Pacific!).... then I found out about the free popcorn. The rest is history!

Really good bar to relax, chat with a friend and have a few drinks. It's not bad for people-watching too! Looking forward to more nights under the dim lights of Northstar Cafe!
author: Guida B.

description: Reasonable drinks, popcorn, pool, and sports. Super friendly bartenders and local vibes. Would def go backfot A chill night!
author: Zara S.

description:
Oh man, we had a freaking blast in at the Northstar Cafe.

Looking for a place that wasn't 'downtown' but was in a safer neighborhood, we ran into this place randomly (thanks to Yelp's app) and didn't find ourselves leaving for a while.  Prices were amazingly cheap and the service was amazing.

So you might ask yourself: why didn't you give this place 5 stars then? and to that, kind sir or ma'am, to that I would say, this is America and I can do what I want.

Oh, some tips: if you don't like REAL dive bars, find somewhere else.  If you don't like being around fun people: get out of America.  And if you're looking for some place classy: stop reading my reviews.
author: Glen S.

description: It's a straight up dive bar in North Beach that has free popcorn. There's really nothing else to say. It is what it is. I don't think it ever gets that busy so consider bringing a big group here for drinks to pre-party or for your actual party. Get some pizza down the street at Golden Boy when you get hungry.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I went here on a saterday and i must say it wasn't too over crowded and the staff was friendly and quick. 
Pretty much the only downside to this place is that once you leave with the drunkin muchies it is a little hard to find some after bar food.
author: Cescilia A.

description: Awesome dive bar. As a Buffalo Bills fan, I'm here every Sunday bright and early. They have cheap beer and, in my opinion, the best bartenders in SF. Friendly, accommodating, easy going... Always remember our name! Definitely would recommend this bar to any SF Bills fan on Sundays and to anyone else any other day I the week! :)
author: Kailey C.

description:
2012 Drunkcathlon: San Fran Edition. Review #3

Drink requirement: Order any 2 draft beers

Maybe next time we have a generic drink requirement like "order 2 draft beers", we won't leave the choice up to the bartenders. 

The fact that they hooked us up with 2 IPAs made be love them and hate them in the same moment, the hate only coming from the fact that at this point in the competition we were pretty hammered and downing a few Bud Lights would have been a much wiser choice. 

The atmosphere was really great - eclectic and semi-off beat. I can definitely see myself stopping by this place for a San Fran happy hour at some point in the future.
author: Kaity J.

description:
I like this little dive bar because it's not too crowded on a Thursday night, there's a pool table and a good amount of seating, they serve DEE-licious John Daly's (sweet tea vodka, odwalla lemonade), and have several beers on tap for a good price.

I don't see space for dancing, and I don't know why you would dance at this place unless you're completely plastered. On another note, the bouncer was very friendly unlike at many other dive bar places where they scowl at you when you enter.
author: Jess C.

description: My favorite bar in the city, no question! I stumbled upon this place the first weekend I moved to my apartment around the corner 2 years ago, and I'm so glad I did.  Every one of the bartenders are super friendly, they have free popcorn, and a really good happy hour. The regular prices are very reasonable, too. They don't serve food, but Tony's and Golden Boy pizza are around the corner, so bring some of that in if you're hungry. Everyone I've taken here has loved it too. Stop in, watch a game, grab a drink & some free popcorn, and enjoy!
author: Shawna P.

description:
Great little bar in North Beach. Myself and a buddy were looking for a place to watch the 9:00 am UCLA v. Nebraska game. We were planning to go to the Boardroom across the street, but it was filled to capacity with a Stanford crowed watching their early game.

Northstar bartender was amazing. We had full volume for our game, and our  beers never dropped below 10% for the 5 hour duration we were there, a free shot on the house to celebrate a UCLA victory, can't really ask for more. I can't speak to the nighttime crowd here, but we really enjoyed watching a couple of early afternoon games at this place. 

Pros: Plenty of TV's, great staff, great location, decent draft beer lineup. 
Cons: Doesn't serve food (but were allowed to bring a sandwich in from a neighboring legitimate deli).
author: David H.

description: M-F happy hour from 1-7 $4 well drinks and beer. Very chill laid back place. Bartender is very nice and the place has inexpensive drinks. A big plus in the city or anywhere for that matter  not fancy in the least but not dirty either (no sticky floors ) would come back if I was in the area and just want to chill for a few hours. They have free pool and popcorn!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Whadda know? Another totally overdue review!

Came here at the end fo JANUARY to see a fellow UC Davis grad DJ. I'd never been to Northstar Cafe before, but thought it was a cool spot.

The place was packed, but seemed to be a good mix of people. Nobody overly boisterous, creepy, or whatever other negative word you want to go with!

Throughout the night, the line outside just continued to grow. I don't know if this this standard, or if it had to do with DJ Harrison...

Cool place, I'd go back.
author: Annalise F.

description: If this isn't one of the niftiest lil' bars in North Beach, I'd love to learn of a more enjoyable hang in the 'hood. No pretention, daily drink specials that won't break the bank, and best of all, whether or not you're a regular, it feels like home.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I've come by here for drinks a few times when wandering the area. Major bonus, they have a few awesome ciders (since I'm really not a fan of beer). The inside is kind of small, so it's not the best place to go if you have a large crowd, but it's friendly, has a great atmosphere, and a good range of drinks plus bar food.

I definitely enjoy stopping by here for a drink while out in the North Beach/Chinatown area.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Excellent choice for getting a nice cocktail during the day. At night it gets a bit crazy and packed. The drinks seem to become more expensive as the night goes on too. 

If you're a rum drinker, I do NOT recommend their well rum choice. It was disgusting. I had never even heard of it and it didn't even taste like rum. 

We've had some nice times here though, all during the day. Again, at night, especially if there is any game on, it just gets way too loud and packed with screaming people. So if you're not there to watch sports I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Roxanne R.

description:
Came here on a Sunday to watch football with a friend. It was his suggestion, and after reviewing Yelp I was prepared for the worst. Luckily, I was pleasantly surprised and had a really great time.

For starters, the place was not packed. I suppose this was because it was Sunday afternoon and the local sports teams had been eliminated from competition, so that reduced the number of folks inside. In turn, we had a really great table against the wall, offering a great view of the TVs, with easy access to the bar. Score.

The location of this place is also a plus, as it is close to numerous pizza joints. This meant I was able to run out, grab a pie for my friends, and enjoy it at the bar. Nobody working there said anything, which is also nice. Pizza and beer at a bar with big screen TVs. Win.

Drinks were reasonable, but I don't like the $20 minimum credit charge. I'm surprised at how many establishments don't know that this is illegal and that it will get them punished by the credit card companies.
author: Wes T.

description:
What have I found here, you ask?  A pig-skin and booze loving gem of a tavern thoughtfully situated on the corner of Powell and Green.  WAIT!  It's also an LSU football hub for alumni and fans on Saturdays?!?  Correction, I found a little piece of Tiger heaven that was cosmically placed in a consecrated spot in North Beach.

A divey atmosphere with spectacular service and a friendly crowd to boot.  The most popular tip I've read about this place was that it has free pool (one pool table) and free popcorn (you'll know when it's time for that).  This review will only recognize the Saturday festivities during football season when this establishment gets turned into a purple and gold affair.  Here's the magical part that will make even the biggest non-LSU and non-football fan a believer in Saturday as the new Funday: $3 domestics, $4 Blue Moon draft; $3 Tiger Claw (a shot consisting of vodka, cranberry & razz-ma-tazz), $4 Abita Amber, $4 Abita Purple Haze.  My boyfriend and I drank for the entire LSU/Kent St. game for a whopping $40!  That's 3 hours of back-to-back brewskies into the empty abyss known as our guts.  An added loveliness, perhaps highlight to some, of Saturdays at Northstar is the appearance of Family Meal, a splendidly appetizing pop-up that does only bar food.  On Saturdays they bring out the southern hospitality as well as the culinary crafts of home town cooking to make you want to wrestle alligators while slurping down a dozen oysters.  These reminiscent dishes range from traditional red beans and rice, shrimp and okra gumbo, New Orleans style BBQ shrimp, bread pudding and more.  They update their twitter with locations and menu items for your perusing.  

As much as I'm boasting about Northstar as my alma mater's stomping grounds, they also cater and welcome other teams and schools.  This is SF, so all your Cali teams are represented appropriately.  But, bear your purple and gold pride and you'll open your Saturdays to a life of worthwhile camaraderie.  #AllNewFriends.  Come experience some great football, great food and great service.  Don't be a Debbie Downer.

Side Note: Slowly solidifying Ryan L.'s (a Texan, born and bred - important if you know about the ongoing Texas/Louisiana battle of the football beasts) love for me and the Tigers, thanks to Northstar's sensationally spectacular Saturdays.  Deuces.
author: Angie N.

description:
I have loved this bar since I had my birthday party here and have taken every opportunity to make my friends come back with me. It's a casual dive bar with reasonably priced drinks, tons of TVs playing sports games, and free popcorn (with hot sauce...I swear, it's really good even though my friends hate it when I put it on the popcorn).

Anyway, the real reason I am breaking my Yelping hiatus is for their awesome owner, bartenders, and staff. We held our Team in Training fundraiser here and everyone was so helpful -- they set us up with a table, cash box, and wristbands. All we had to do was show up with my friend's beautifully made glittery poster and invite our friends to show up! All my friends had a great time at the bar too and we didn't even take advantage of their offer to use the iPod speakers to play Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez nonstop!
author: Esther K.

description: Came here with a couple of my buddies for a couple of drinks and free games of pool. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was overall great! I would highly recommend this bar if you are looking for a good time.
author: Tino Y.

description:
North Star Cafe is the least cafe Cafe I've ever been to. :)

No, but really, it's a cool place. Free pool and popcorn and happy hour til an undefined hour (some say 7, some say 7:30, some say 8, I don't think anybody really knows).

Lots of seating, bartenders impressively attentive for having a number of people in the "cafe" that would far and away surpass what the fire code would recommend as a maximum number of patrons at any one time.

Our bill wasn't what we expected, but I think it's because my friend's definition and their definition of "well drink" didn't jibe. And there were so many people in there, why bother.

I'd come back, why not?
author: Conrad B.

description:
MARK AND MOLLY ARE THE MOST AWESOME GIANTS GAME HOSTS EVERRRRR!

Free popcorn. Free pool. Happy Hour prices were HAPPY Happy Hour prices.

Great people, crowd's super friendly, lively and welcoming. If I lived in the area, this would be my go-to bar, and once again, Mark and Molly ROCK!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
This place is awesome. Just finished a fundraiser happy hour. Mark was very generous to allow us to do it on a Friday. 

The service is great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is perfect. They play good music that's loud enough to enjoy but I'm still able to hold a conversion.  I will definitely be coming back.
author: Kendra P.

description: The most awesome place to go for game day! The bartenders are super attentive and very nice! They have great specials. It was very packed but still fairly easy to get a drink and see the tv.
author: Jena M.

description:
Have been here twice. Most recently after a beach blanket babylon show.

 Its ok. The prices are ok, the choices are ok. The most impressive thing is the free popcorn. The  ladies bathroom is smaller than most San Francisco closets.

 Another patron got sick on part of my skirt and shoe which was really nasty and pissed me off. The guy was definitely over served.
Likely will not go back here. I imagine though that if you are a guy coming here to watch a sports game it would be alright. Not the place to come with a bunch of girl friends to dance and drink though...
author: Tuesday C.

description: We had a great time watching the Bills beat the Jets on Thursday night football! We got there early and staff set our large group up with a table and were very friendly. I don't think they serve any food but there was a food truck outside the night we were there. By end of the night  it was packed!
author: John A.

description:
Any place that spins good music. 

Has a juke-box

Has friendly bar staff, that are quick to refill your water glass.

Has a kind bouncer - that allows you to bring in food.

Has free popcorn.

Has a pool table.

Has a dance floor (well once the pool table is moved...this place is fairly tiny)

Has a pool table that turns into a mini dance floor (not sure if this is customary) on the weekend.

Is a place worth visiting.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This bar is by far the best in San Francisco. In case you hadn't guessed I already love this bar. But Caskey is amazing. Always pouring me the best drinks, the friendliest girl ever, and has an AMAZING body. Who could ask for more in a bartender. 

Come here. Find Caskey, and tell her she looks gorgeous and then tip her damn well.
author: David D.

description:
Like a shiny beacon of tasty cocktails guiding you to a comfy bar stool. 

The Yelp Elite event Drink & Hunt began here. As usual, I arrived late and was unable to truly partake in this cozy little corner shop bar. I definitely could see myself frequenting this spot more. Not too big, they have very friendly bar staff, and a pool table in back. I think I'll challenge their Ol' fashion skills and order one next time I'm there.

After all our waivers were signed and teams divided, we set out upon the streets of Little Italy for the hunt.
author: Andrew D.

description: This place has the best pint of Guinness in the city, hands down. I've been to Kell's (great friggin' bar), Irish Bank (great friggin' bar), Royal Exchange (great friggin' bar with hot secretaries) and numerous other bars with Guinness, but this place has the creamiest head and the smoothest draw. I don't know if it's the clean taps and lines, the right pressure of nitrogen (sans CO2) or the fact that their happy hour goes from 1pm to 7pm, but I love this place.Service can be a bit slow but that's fine when they serve the perfect pint. I'm willing to wait and will order well in advance so they can double pour a proper pint. It's just off the beaten path enough to  keep the flood of tourist away, but it always has a nice group of patrons until about 6pm when all the techie douchebags start filing in with their horn rimmed glasses and beards and J Crew shirts. That's when we head out...
author: Mike C.

description:
Truly a great place to meet friends, enjoy after work drinks, watch great sports and have great service from one of the best bars in San Francisco. Once you walk in you will notice the BT's will see you, toss a napkin down and make sure they take care of you before they finish a conversation with another patron. Sign of excellence.

Great staff, great owners great patrons!
author: Luke G.

description: One of my favorite dives in San Francisco. Typically a friendly crowd, cool bar staff and inexpensive drinks. What's not to love!
author: Larry T.

description: Best HH, free popcorn, free pool, TV's, Giants fan bar, great staff and packed with nice cool people!! Order pizza from NB pizza or Golden Boy and bring it in... Just make sure to buy booze and clean up after yourself! Cheers!
author: Jsphn T.

description: Cheap beer, strong drinks, good service. Why the 2 stars. Walk in to this place during the day and you will see. It is one of the dirtiest bars I have ever seen. I would not order a draft. I understand the whole run down type of beach shack theme they are trying to go for, but it is more of a dirty/run down look.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Best bar to pull up a stool at the bar and hang out with the super cool bartenders and drunks who stay close to the bar for quick access to drinks? Northstar! Northstar! Northstar! Two weekends in a row I have tried this tactic and it guarantees extra Jaeger bombs and other excitement. Basically, if you are the closest girl at this bar, someone will buy you a shot and/or cocktail... 

Halloween night, I decked myself out in Girl Scout attire complete with a box of Girl Scout cookies (they were actually Halloween cookies which I claimed were the Girl Scout Halloween special). I made quick friends with everyone by offering them the cookies including one of the bartenders. In exchange for a $.50 cookie, he offered me free drinks. Awesome! I had a lot of fun grabbing the huge fake boobs of one of my friends too...!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Bills backers bar.

Unlimited free popcorn.

Pool tables.

How can you go wrong?

Super friendly bartenders who are happy to turn on any game you want. Everyone seems to know each other, and you might even meet someone happy to buy a friendly stranger a shot or two. 

Good beers, good people, check it out.
author: caley t.

description: I think this bar would have been fun if you had just turned 21 and were hanging with your frat buddies. Otherwise, you will feel like you are hanging out at a dirty frat house. Super crowded at times, mostly young college looking kids. Average drinks
author: Katrina F.

description: Holly the bartender is awesome! Place can get pretty packed in the front, but the back is very laid back and great to chill. Bathroom is ridiculously small but the men's room has some funny things on the walls. Music is a crazy variety and can range from pop to country to foreigner to rap in a 5 minute period. Pretty Fun.
author: Kayan H.

description: evening pub crawl to northstar cafe...sunset and under night skies...quick identification check...raucous, rowdy and crowded...bar at night...crack of the pool table in back...sardine can crowds inching around...laughter and yelling drowning out the music...squeezing to the bar for a beer....$six guinness high priced for locals...taking one to sip...aged bar with little change from a decade past...same fraternity like crowds...noisy and having fun...
author: Hen A.

description:
This is my favorite dive bar in North Beach. I have spent many Sunday afternoon's watching football and drinking more than my little liver can process. This place can get pretty crowded on the weekends, but totally worth it. 

Be sure to hit up the popcorn machine that is in the corner of the bar, but beware, some pretty nasty fingers may have been diving into that popcorn. My tip to you is, catch the popcorn as it is flying out of the popper. Not only will it be nice and hot, but deliciously nasty-germ-bar hand free! 

Also, they do have a special bar shot called the OBAMARAMA! It is $3, and beware, it may make you forget to catch your fresh popcorn. 

Thanks Northstar for all the memories I don't remember.
author: Katie H.

description: Came here the other night with one of my friends who love the local NB scene. A fundraiser for entrepreneurs in 3rd world countries was being held, and for a donation you could get happy hour prices all night. Definitely a chill place to hang out and see friends.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Cool neighborhood joint with a great Happy Hour.   Best seats are always at the bar but we decided to grab one of the tables next to the window this time because it was a very hot day.  Mind you it really didn't help but it was a cool spot to watch the actions.  

We don't care for the popcorn smell but I guess it helps many to absorb the alcohol or prolong their thirst for more cold ones.

Many 20 something hang out here but there are few seasoned regulars as well.
author: Gloria H.

description: Its alright. There really wasn't anything special about it, and it was pretty empty. The bathroom is RIDICULOUSLY tiny, and really hard to even enter and exit. They were setting up an event in the backroom, and there wasn't much seating in the front. I'd see no reason to come here when Boardroom is right accross the street.
author: Lauren D.

description: Not my favorite North Beach bar. Yes, the music is good and the drinks are reasonably price but really the bar itself is not really that exciting. Small bar in the North Beach neighborhood that is a good place to grab a drink but not much of a destination.
author: Marissa P.

description: I've passed by this place a million times before but never ventured inside until a few nights ago. Ended up here randomly after midnight on a Friday night and it was packed until closing time. I think I will come back during a less busy time to play some pool next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Gina G.

description: I love this place. Happy hour every Mon through Fri between 3-7. Drinks are $3-7 and they have tons of specials, free hot popcorn, free pool, friendly locals, awesome bartenders, etc. Best happy hour spot in North Beach by far. And the drinks are stiff.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Stopped in yesterday for a Spanish themed event......

Had a great time.....

Lots of nice tv's, plenty of beers on tap, affordable prices, quick staff, daily specials, free pool, and clean bathroom.

It is tough finding parking, but it's worth it...

Good times all around.
author: Joe B.

description:
Love this bar- awesome bartenders-great location-laid back crowd- instant fan--
-Mustache's welcome
author: Shell N.

description:
What isn't there to love about Northstar.  Every bartender is great.  And you may even find the owners running around some nights.  

Shanghai Kelly's is their sister bar.  And by that, i mean owned buy the same people.  You'll find the same great bartenders at both!
author: Matt J.

description:
Up there as favorite bars in Sf. Laid back, cheap drinks, diverse crowd.
Pros: free pool before 8, free popcorn all night
Add tobasco to your popcorn - find it above or next to the popcorn machine
author: Noah P.

description: Great find! Bartender was great, atmosphere was awesome for a Saturday morning NCAA FB game; finally a sports bar that actually puts that game audio on.  We had a blast and drinks were well priced.this one stays in the rotation!
author: Nathan M.

description:
I LOVE Northstar!

That's about the long and short of it. It's an awesome, casual neighborhood bar with great bartenders (go Sub!), great regulars, and on Sundays during football season it's where you'll find me, bar none, rooting on the Bills. We came here solely because it's the official, unofficial home to all things Buffalo (Bills, Sabres, etc), and ended up coming here on a regular basis for all sporting events (and also just for shits and giggles). Northstar kicks ass. If you think differently, I'll be the gal with the Black & Tan. Come on down.
author: T T.

description:
The US Naval Academy Alumni have chosen Northstar as our weekly watering-hole for the games.  It's a great place to watch a game (football or otherwise) and grab a drink.  The owner is great, and the staff are truly fun.  I feel like a regular just walking in.

There is no food, but they have many menus behind the bar to look at for ordering delivery.

If you want a fun local bar...this is it.
author: Eric S.

description:
This is not the place to stumble into in 5" patent leather heels... but I unwittingly did anyway. It smells like the floorboards are soaked in beer but I'm a fan of the non-pretentious atmosphere, the music was fabulous ("Shoop"? Yes please!), the people were friendly and I got complimented on my heels and dancing skills by some lurpy old guy in the corner. 

If that doesn't make your night, I don't know what will.
author: Eli B.

description: Great place, we always come here to watch hockey !!! We are from Southern California and love this bar, no food but Molly the bartender is friendly and will put whatever you want on the tv !!!! Great find !!!!
author: Kopi O.

description:
It's a Buffalo bar, so it's got to be fun!  Free popcorn, pool, decent drinks, and overall a good place to hang out.  

The plus and negative of this place is the same.  His name is Frank.  The old man must not have a job, because he is there all the time (ok, so maybe I'm jealous).  Frank will ask you the same sports trivia questions each time you meet him, so be prepared.  Here they are: 1) Name all of the sports teams that have the same name (ex. Arizona Cardinals and St. Louis Cardinals), and 2) How many ways are there for a baseball batter to get on base (hint, there are 10). Also watch out, Frank is a pool shark.  You have been warned.
author: Dave L.

description: Locals say it isn't one of the niftiest lil' bars in North Beach, but to me it was great...I'd love to learn of a more enjoyable hang in the 'hood. No pretention, drink specials that won't put a hole in your pocket, and best of all, whether or not you're a regular, it feels like home.
author: J-Pierre E.

description:
Came here to watch the USA get eliminated from the 2006 World Cup in the first round of play.

Seems like a friendly-enough place, just not sure what would bring me back. Americans playing great soccer?
author: Miriam W.

description:
LOVE this place...so it smells like urine at times, but if you are in North Beach this is the best place to end your night. Good music, good drinks, and good crowd. 

Hey I will trust any place that has "Happy Hour Sponsored by Betty Ford Clinic" any day. Best nights our Thursday - Saturday.
author: Nate E.

description: Three dollar pints all day, in the North Beach \ Russian Hill area?    Yes please! :)
author: William R.

description: Every Wednesday Northstar Cafe is the start of Rock Paper Scissor pup crawl tournament. Pay $5 to enter the tournament and then draft beers are $2.50. There is also a pool table in the the back of the bar.
author: William B.

description: good place to hang out when it's not too crowded. basic atmosphere with nice beer selection.
author: Jeb P.

description: Fun atmosphere, nice bartenders, and familiar faces.  I always have a good time here (sometimes a little too much of a good time).  And they have a pool table.
author: Bud L.

description:
All I can say is boo! HORRIBLE music all night! It sounded like cheesy alternative "goodbye" music you would hear at the end of a high school graduation.
The bar was so unbelievably crowded I felt like a pinball being literally hit around as people tried to get past. The room is pretty small with little seating. There's only one girls bathroom stall which made for an uncomfortable long wait with some wasted girl locking herself in there for literally 20 minutes! All of us in line tried getting help from the bartenders and bouncers; all they said was "sorry I can't help, you'll just have to wait"!

Overall, bad experience and a place you will not see me going back to. There are better places in North Beach.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
We stopped by Northstar one night before taking on the all you can eat sushi challenge at Sushi Hunter.  You would think we'd be smarter than filling our stomachs up with beer first...but we had time to kill.

Happy hour, M-F, 1-8.  Um, HELLO!  8!

We got a table in the back and immediately realized that everyone in the back room was already belligerent.  Resisting the urge to join the party (since we had dinner plans, after all), we kept to ourselves in our booth and goofed off on our own.

Will be back!
author: Jenny L.

description:
$4.50 for a pint of Racer 5.  Thumbs up for the appearance of a complete dive sports bar.  Not much more to say.  Came here, dranked two beers, moved along.

This might be a fun place for Super Bowl...
author: Chris B.

description:
LOVE this place. A group of friends and I came here on a detour during the lame San Francisco Urban Beer Hunt after the bartender up the street at The Boardroom threw a hissy fit (see other review).

Free popcorn and pool! A decent draft selection. Looks like they have a pretty good Happy Hour during the week. The bartender was very friendly. We were there mid-afternoon so the place was pretty chill with a good crowd. Needless to say, we didn't finish the beer hunt and closed out the day here instead. I would come back to this place if I find myself in the area.
author: Rachel H.

description: Popcorn pubs are my favorite. Northstar is a popcorn pub. As soon as you enter this cozy gem, hook a right to scoop a bowl of popcorn before placing your drink order. Slide down the long bar counter, sipping your beverage and sharing good conversation with inviting strangers. I love good conversation with inviting strangers. By the time you reach the end of this counter, it's time to order beverage number two from your friendly bartender. With drink in hand, make your way to the back where you'll be greeted by a pool table and booths. I didn't get a chance to get my pool on last time, but next time I definitely will.
author: Jaime L.

description: This place was pretty sweet! I came here with the guys and had tons of fun! I wasn't sure if this was actually the place until I read the review about the funny pics in the mens room. =) The people here were a mixture and pretty chill, surprisingly. There were guys in business suits playing pool and getting drunk. They were hilarious and friendly people. I like it when guys can actually get along at a bar. Drinks were awesome, although I don't remember what I drank.
author: Nani V.

description:
I've made it to Northstar a few times, and it's usually via O'Reilly's.

The bar tenders are nice and you can pick out a few songs on the jukebox if that's your thing. Beer and mixed drinks seem priced on par for a casual San Fran bar.  A no frills vibe minus the blinking distraction from the strip clubs on Columbus is a definite relief.

They recently hosted a nice event benefiting the Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Foundation. They decorated, ran drink specials, and donated their proceeds from the night, very cool.
author: Theresa T.

description:
Nothin' but love for Northstar!

This place is literally stumbling distance from my apartment and many a night bar hopping around North Beach has ended here. My fav dive bar in SF for sure!

They have popcorn, cheap drinks and friendly staff. We hosted a North Beach pubcrawl and Northstar were super friendly, an ace night was had by all. Myself included, which entailed me abandoning my jacket here (oops). Shows how chill the clientele are, when I finally realized that I was sans jacket a couple of days later (I am a hot mess, I know), it was hanging up happily on the Northstar coat rack! 
The barman here has also sheltered me from the rain and offered me a free drink whilst I was waiting to get my Zipcar out from the valet lot next door - awesome (although for purposes of not drink-driving I abstained!). 

This place is also a sports mecca and they'll put anything on for you. I have even seen watched my English rugby team on TV in this place - love.

Only downside I could think of is the frequency with which my friends leave open tabs here and have to reclaim their cards in the morning - can't say this is Northstar's fault though!
author: Ciera M.

description:
Awesome place! Went and watched Champion's League Final there yesterday and had a smashing good time. Guys running the place let us in early so we could yap about football an hour before the match and after my team, Inter Milan wrapped up their 3rd European Championship, the shots they were a flowing. 

Thanks for the memory and the hospitality lads, I imagine I'll be spending some more early weekends there for matches.
author: Tony C.

description:
I walk in.  I hear Jesse's Girl.  A bit later, I hear "Josie's on a vacation far away...."    Sold.  [but the covers I have of these are much more awesome.]  

Friendly bartenders who, when I tried to do a blow job, studied my efforts, assured the jeering crowd, "yes, her mouth does NOT fit around it.  She gets a pass."
Umm, I'm talking about the shot... not THAT.

Pool table, divey bar.  Love it.
author: Meg W.

description: Quaint little dive bar.  I broke $100 & the bartender stiffed me $10 in change.   I only noticed after I had walked away from the bar with our first round of drinks.  Guess I should have paid more attention.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I like popcorn. And beer. And juke boxes with lots of Michael Jackson. Northstar has all these things. And to boot, my boyfriend lives across the street.

I watched a few football games here last season and they make a mean bloody mary which was good Sunday morning companion. Just don't expect to be at all productive after having two :)

Pretty bare bones and by no means fancy, but that is just how this girl rolls sometimes.
author: Katie W.

description:
OK I  don't get it.  Seriously...

Every female I know absolutely LOVES this place and insists on dragging me here.  Like no joke they always want to come.  What I don't get, is that if all women seem to love th eplace, how does it turn into a sausage fest every time!?!?!!  

All the bartenders are pretty friendly and the vibe of the place is pretty chill on a weekday night.  Weekends get pretty crazy, and when it gets too crowded it loses it's allure pretty damn quick.  

stays fun if you can get a table though, and the pool table in back is definately clutch.  Guys room has some great reading material for while you pee!!
author: Joseph F.

description:
Great Bills bar in the city but warning it get crowded....and if they lose watch out!

Free popcorn and pool, who could ask for anything more?!?! oh yeah, I guess great bartenders-they have those too. The guys are always more then welcoming and even when my Vikings lost the bid to the super bowl (farve fail) I got a hug and a free beer...just the kinda bar I love in my neighborhood.

See you soon Northstar!
author: Ka C.

description:
Long happy hour, free popcorn, lots of tvs with sports on them.  If this is your thing, then you'll love this place.  We started out here before wandering elsewhere on a Friday and it fit the mold very well.  

It wasn't crowded, music was decent, and the bill was miniature.  Nothing spectacular here, but everything was good.
author: William B.

description:
It was the classiness of Girls Gone Wild meeting with the excitement of Mardi Gras.  If you showed your breasts to the oaf in the joker's hat, he would give you fifty dollars.  He was yelling at the sweaty slugs dancing to Brass Monkey.  His mic cut on and off, so all they could hear was: "That's right, ...give you fif... bucks ... the sexiest pair of ... So, c'mon! ... them out and ..... them around. Yeahh!  It's st...... to get ... in here!  Whooo..ooo Hoo...oooo!"    

The ecstasy was working.  One bar stool was doing a handstand on another bar stool and begging someone to dance with.  The guy in the trenchcoat was impressed and threw his beads on them.  One of the stools must have said something sleazy, because Trenchcoat started swinging at it and his friend Mohawk had to hold him back.  

The beer selection was super and you couldn't get kicked out of here if you tried.  Even the couch potatoes were there to order a Miller and lip read the television newscast off of the killer flat screen.  As you can imagine, it's more chill during the week.  But you would feel like you'd be missing out if you didn't check this out on a Saturday on your way to O'Reilly's.
author: Kenny R.

description: I stumbled into this bar as a tourist and it was great!  Great atmosphere, music, friendly, cool, & safe vibe from the peeps.  I didn't try the food. They have a HH and free pool (think it was HH only), free wifi always, and I think it said free popcorn...not sure when on that.
author: Tera T.

description:
This is fun, local bar. We headed over this way after the Giants beat the Dodgers yesterday. The smell of popcorn lured me in as the skies opened up and began pouring rain. 

There are tvs showing different games and a popcorn machine that kept many bowls full. 

There's nothing fancy about this place but it's a great place to just chill and kickback with great friends and good alcohol.
author: Julia W.

description: Definitely part of the dive bar variety, and it may smell like foot and stale beer when you walk in, but don't  let that discourage you from making a visit. Like most places in San Francisco, this place has friendly bartenders and good happy hour deals (3 dollar drafts). Throw in free billiards and popcorn and you have a spot that's not that bad to get together at. Don't count on sitting down but the opening area is large enough to stand and hang out comfortably. Could see this place getting three and a half stars but it caters to Cal fans, so I round down in that case (not really... but seriously)
author: Taylor C.

description:
Any bar can sell booze....but its really the company the bar keeps that makes it special.

Northstar is it. You don't get the yuppies or the pop'ed collars. You get genuine, real, people. And that's why I love it here. You can go straight from the office, or in jeans and a tshirt and no one really cares, but its always a really good time.

Another huge plus about Northstar, the owner Mark is always willing to support local charities and goes out of his way to make each event successful. Not only does he open his bar up for you to collect donations, he encourages everyone to participate in the fundraiser.

Mark is truly an amazing guy and I am so thankful to have an awesome bar in the neighborhood. Good people, good drinks and hot guys. (That's really why I love Northstar) Plus they have hot fresh popcorn, sports games on TV, and hot guys.

Cheers! and many thanks Northstar!
author: sierra s.

description: My mobile yelp checkin says I was here. So I must have had fun.
author: Patrick G.

description:
One star off because they didn't Close Caption the High End Prostitution story on CNBC. I really wanted to know the ins and outs of being a high priced whore...I mean, call girl. You never know. This IS San Francisco, you know.

Great prices on Happy Hour drinks and how can you beat a 7 hour Happy Hour? Freaking A! That's almost as long as a whole shift at work! Think of the havoc I could wreak on this place if I were there all day. Think of all the pints I could drink...Hmmmmmmm......


Great bartender. Very friendly and will talk to you if you want someone to talk to. I think he is into FPS on the game consoles so you can open with that as a first topic. I had a wonderful companion to drink with and to try and educate about on hockey. You will succumb to the thrills of hockey. Yes, you will!!!
author: Anthony L.

description:
2:09am: Just got back from Northstar (walked home, only a few blocks away).  Still enjoying the drunken state.  Bottomless beers (FREE refills for me and my roommate) = Pure Happiness!
 
Yes, we had a never-ending glass of beer, when we were low, Marc (the bartender) will grab our glasses and refill it with beer... not once, not twice, but 4 times!  Marc is nice, not sleazy, but very friendly and many of the drinkers knew him.  He's super cool and complimented us about our  'lids' (roommate and I were both wearing unique Goorin hats).  When guys will come up to my friend and me to buy us drinks, Marc was there to tell them to leave us alone, plus we didn't need random men buying us drinks.  I hate standing up when I drink, so we were lucky that we scored prime real estate seats right by the bar.  

The bar is small, good space though and pretty crowded.  First thing I thought of when I walked in... Marina, I thought I was in the Marina because of the frat boys and Blondies.  As the night went on, I started noticing that there was a good mix of people including college kids, locals and an older crowd. 

$4 beers on tap and $3 for Pabst, why not call it PBR, I don't know...  I hear Northstar usually have free popcorn, but last night, there was none, therefore I was a bit disappointed.  At the end of the night, I didn't care about the popcorn anymore and just enjoyed my time by watching three different sports of television and checking out some of the cute boys -- great eye candy :-)!

WARNING:  One of the bartender is a Boston Redsox (Redsucks) fan... BOO!
author: Celeste M.

description:
First off, this bar really isn't that divey...

We came here post-North Beach Festival, and it was jam packed.  I don't know how anyone was playing pool, there was barely enough room to stand.  Luckily enough though, it was also beautiful people central, so although you were being stepped on and manhandled, it was by really pretty people...which is always better, right?

And, everyone in the bar was making eyes, like "hey sexy..." eyes at everyone else.  It was ridiculous, I felt like every time I looked up I saw people undressing each other with their gazes...

Drinks aren't cheap, but it's ok...to get your money's worth you just need to order a Long Island...t's HUGE.  I got a Long Island and everyone else ordered Vodka Soda/Tonics and my drink totally dominated theirs, it was like 3x bigger...and for $9 instead of $6, it was a much better deal.  

Soooo.............................................................
5 stars for everyone making sexy eyes at eachother.  
4 stars for my monster Long Island.  
1 star for the bar kinda smelling like bathroom.  
2 stars for poor music choices and for playing Shakira twice in a row.
author: Katherine C.

description: In a neighborhood I hardly ever go to but one I probably will start to frequent solely because of this gem.  There is nothing foo foo here but it is fun, clean, and laid back. There seemed to me such a good mix of people their too. Also seemed to play a nice variety of music, and they kept it at a good volume so as to still be able to converse easily. Cheap drinks, free popcorn (with hot sauce), free pool.... whats there to complain about!?! :)
author: Trista L.

description:
I heard about this place when I trained for Nike Women's Marathon through Team in Training through a friend that had did a previous fundraiser here. If your not familiar with Team in Training, its a non profit that raises money for the Leukemia and Lymphoma society by training participants for events while they fundraise for the society. I don't have a personal connection to the cause so raising $2500 was a difficult task. I called the place and got in touch with the owner. He was super friendly to assist me and make sure he gave me tons of help and resources to make my event night successful!

On the day of the fundraiser the staff was super friendly and helpful, they even provided me with a money box and raffle tickets to use during my fundraiser! I had a lot of fun and had even more fun later watching my friends hustle random drunk dudes for $10 for my fundraiser so they could get $2.50 pints! Very chill atmosphere.. would definitely come here again if I was closer to the city. 1 shot and 4 pints of Blue Moon later I left very drunk and with over $200 to donate to the society! GO TEAM!
author: Trina M.

description:
Best thing about this place, is the sign outside that says, "Voted best happy hour by the Betty Ford Clinic".  lol.  Made me laugh.

Everyone loves this place.  I don't get it.
author: Sandy C.

description:
This place makes happy hour even more happy. I walk in and feel happy instantly. I leave feeling happy (and slightly buzzed), I remain happy for the rest of the night. Northstar Cafe, you make me happy. Thanks! 

I have only been here for happy hour, not on a Friday or Saturday night, so I can not attest to the weekend crowd, during the week it is casual, laid back, local, and relaxed. Just the place you want to chill on a week night with friends. 

I saw some pool tables, they have seats by the windows, full bar, attentive bar tenders (a requirement to make me happy). Can't wait to go back!
author: Jessica R.

description:
Friendly neighborhood bar during the week, meat market on weekends.

I enjoy going here. It's usually pretty crowded on Fridays and Saturdays. Like ourselves, everyone here is pretty. We take bets on which cuties will end up making out with which of the frat boys. A very entertaining place.
author: Gabor C.

description: I immediately liked the unpretentious, casual divey feel and found the bouncers/bartenders really pleasant. My only complaints? The drinks were not dive-bar-cheap.
author: Sarah B.

description:
When you need a taste of home (East Coast)..... Northstar
When you are looking for a chill place..... Northstar
When you want cool bartenders..... Sub at Northstar
When you want to watch the Patriots or any team.... Northstar
When you want to chill with Boston peps.... Northstar
Where everyone knows your name..... Cheers
When you just need the score of the game, but stay for drinks.... Northstar
When you want a great time..... Northstar

$20 min charge for credit cards
ATM's around the corner
One Pool Table in the back
Small Bathrooms
No food is served here except POPCORN, but feel free to bring your own grub.
author: Po L.

description:
This bar has some versatility 

What do I mean by that.. Well by first glance Northstar is a small little dive.. lots of TVs. You may say to your friends, hey lets go watch the game at Northstar.. and chill in our sweatshirts.

At second glance Northstar surprises all by turning into a dance party. They move the pool table in the back (and cover it nicely so drunk girls can dance on top of it when feeling up for the challenge) and pull out the giant speakers. The DJ this particular night graced us with "I'm on a boat" not once, but twice (If I hadn't been present the entire evening this replay would not have been an issue). 

The crowd was great, a couple guys came up and danced with my girlfriends and I and they were so much fun (not those creepy I wanna be on you guys that you tend to find at a dance club). 

Downfall: the tiny bathroom... wow.. seriously tiny.
author: Hailey P.

description: Pretty much my 2nd fav bar in North Beach after Columbus Cafe of course. Usually a fair amount of people here, but never packed sardine style. Never encountered any form of douchebaggery knock on wood.... never really had a hassle getting something to drink and they almost always have some sort of special going. Especially fun here during the day during football season. Seems like a big Michigan bar. One thing that's kind of a pain in the ass is there's a minimum for debit/CC's. Not that big a deal I guess because a lot of bars are cash only.
author: Morris D.

description:
This is a good little place. I'd never been there before last night, and I'd definitely come back. It's a little smallish... more like narrow, but it's still not too bad. The bar staff was extremely quick taking orders, and everyone was in a pretty good mood there. 

I guess since it was a Friday night, they were playing their own music off their sound system, but I flipped through the jukebox anyway, and it definitely looks promising. No Eddie Money or Rick Springfield, but hey, nobody's perfect.

Hilarious sign painted on the wall outside that says "Voted #1 Happy Hour by Betty Ford Clinic". Nice.

If I was a week boozer and I worked in the city, I'd definitely stop by this place after work for some $3.00 beers. Good scene overall.
author: Dan P.

description:
I'm always wasted by the time I get to Northstar and if I'm not, it's not too far off in the horizon.

This is a great bar off the beaten track in North Beach.  I have to agree with some of the earlier reviews on yes, it's mostly ex-frat guys and they're definitely cute and friendly.

It gets a little crowded here on some nights but the drinks are cheap, there's a pool table in the back and a fun jukebox with a good hip hop and rock selection.

This place is casual...feel free to wear your sweats/gym clothes.
author: Jenny K.

description:
My Uncle Walt (not a real uncle, but one of those family friend ones) owned this bar back in the 60s-70s. I logged a lot of hours here as a kid. Back then, women were only allowed in at lunchtime and had to sit in a booth and never at the bar. The cook was a Chinese guy named Fee, who made a wicked red sauce. He's the one who told me to always put a shot of vodka in. 

The place hasn't physically changed all that much. Whenever I go in I feel five years old again. I think Walt and Ernie and Fee would be happy.
author: Chris E.

description: At first I wasn't a fan of this place, but having the chance to go there for a few week day sessions has greatly improved my opinion. It can get pretty crowded on weekend nights, so if that's what you're looking for you're in luck. It seems to be a good crowd pleaser, with spots at the bar near the action and a few booths toward the back by the pool table for when you don't want to be in the middle of it all. It's not too touristy, people here know each other and all tend to behave accordingly. It took me a while to come around, but now I'm a fan.
author: Mark K.

description:
Update: They've raised their prices to $3.00 a pint.  Minus one more star.
Happy hour $2.50 from 1-8, but beware, their clocks run 20 minutes fast and they'll try and charge you regular prices at 7:40.   If you're still sober enough, point out the time problem to them and they'll give you happy hour prices.  I'll volunteer on behalf of my fellow yelpers to see if happy hour actually starts 20 minutes early.
The bathroom pictures are pretty entertaining too, although, I can't attest to what they have plastered up in the ladies room.  It might be possible to convince me to volunteer to find that out as well.
author: Nosniv X.

description:
We came here on Saturday night, trying to get my Huskies game on TV. There were various college football games on TV saturday night including Cal, but UW was on one of the other TVs. The bartender was very happy to change one of the TVs in order to get the game on a TV where we could sit and watch the game.

The bar was pretty cool. Not too nice, but not too bad either. There was the main bar, then some tall tables and chairs with another room that had a few booths and a pool table in the middle with about 6 flat screens. 

Great experience! I had someone yell "Washington! Boo!", but that's part of the fun of a sports bar. The bartender even introduced himself to me later and said that anytime I come in, he'll have the game on. Too bad I don't live in SF, or I'd be here for every Husky game. He even came by later when we made a good play and gave me the fist.  A fun bar that I'll definitely be hitting up when I'm in the city!
author: Seila K.

description:
It's the holidays... let's start with the good.  a classic dive bar (although can you have 5 HD tv's and still be a dive bar?) with free pool til 8pm... and if you're lucky they'll probably forget to lock up the table and you can continue to save 75 cents at a time.  Oh, and there's free popcorn which goes well with all the carnies that frequent this spot.

But the rest of the evening it was like i was walking around with duct tape shoes.... adhesive out.  there is so much spilt beer here... unclear whether this is out of respect for fallen comrades (ie, like in compton when they pour out a little liquor for my homies) or if some of the patrons have tourettes.  or maybe beer is just too damn cheap here so they can just waste it.  blasphemy!

either way, it was great playing pool using a crutch instead of the pool cue.  at least i had an excuse for all the missed shots.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Used to like this place but the last 5 times or so that I've been there its waaaaaay to crowded.  I'm talking shoulder to shoulder and people get pushy and spill drinks everywhere.  I realize that most bars get crowded on weekends but when Northstar gets crowded, I never have a good time.  Its not a good kind of crowded.  Also - the door man accused my 24 year old friend of showing a fake ID and almost didn't let him in.  Not cool...
I'm giving it an extra star because when you can actually walk in this place, it can be really fun and they play great music.
author: Cassie B.

description:
If someone called me and said: "Look, I'm in search of the worst bar in San Francisco," I would likely know exactly where to turn.

Description:
-Arrogant, dismissive and moronic bartenders
-The absolute worst clientele you could possibly imagine (frat boys galore)
-A jukebox that would fit a frat house, circa 1992

That about sums it up. You'd have to place a loaded revolver to my head to get me back into this dump.
author: K F.

description: Very cool place to meet up with friends. A lot of regulars and people who are just lounging around, chatting it up with friends, or wanting to watch sports (not me).
