I've spent a many nights meeting up with dates here and every time I've been, its always been a blast. I'm probably the only Asian girl there most of the time, but hell, I like it that way =). Casual, fun, loud, great place to hang out in jeans and a tank. I wouldn't wear my stilettos here =)
author: Katie Anne N.

description: ...What David D. said.  This place has become my new living room. It is a great place for North Beach locals to hang out (at least during the day) and is a place I look forward to going to.  On any given day, you are sure to see someone you know at least by face. The bartenders all remember your name and what you like to drink.  Sometimes, when I am walking up Powell getting ready to head into the pub, Caskey (one of the bartenders) will see me walking up and have my beer poured and waiting for me before I walk in the door. Great place for daytime drinking and a happy hour you can't beat.
author: Nathan F.

description:
Northstar is the neighborhood spot. In fact I just flat out call it "the Bar."

All the bartenders are super friendly and treat the regulars like family. Sub always greets me with a smile and smooch on the cheek. They have free pool, an amazing jukebox and a rowdy following of local peeps.

I don't recommend it on a Friday or Saturday night, happy hour or day time sports watching is the best. I mean, geez $3 pints and well drinks Mon-Fri from 1pm to 8pm??? AMAZING.

I heart the NStar
author: Lynsey C.

description:
Came here a few times when one of my good friends lived in the area. 

Total dive bar but a great place to get sloshfaced! And it seemed like we were the only ladies in a bar full of middle-aged guys...
author: Britney C.

description: Happy hour starting really early in the afternoon with all draft beers for $3...of course I'm a fan!
author: Allyson P.

description: Been coming here for a long time, not realizing they had a great happy hour. It is an old bar, but it doesn't have an old bar feel to it. Not my favorite place, but it is always a good pit stop in this part of town...
author: Jim B.

description: My friend said hey,lets go play pool,we got there,and its free pool! you have to love that,i been going there ever since,pool,good beer,and the locals are nice,and the bartenders are nice as well,very good bar to go chill,play pool or a casual date
author: Kristopher M.

description:
Northstar does not disappoint. There's always a crowd brewing. I didn't say a good crowd, but a crowd. One of my favorite ways to end a Sunday Funday is with a brew and a game of pool at the Northstar. 

I don't have much more to say about this place. It's doesn't have any outstanding features, but it does have a pool table, a juke box, Absolut Ruby Red and there's usually some football, I mean soccer on the tube. I love it! Bonus: I don't know his name, but he may be the owner...? Greasy dude always wearing the Brasil or Germany jersey. He's got a heavy pour and drinks quite frequently are on the house.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Northstar is a Bills bar and is fun to go to on Sunday mornings- the Bloody Marys are pretty good and the people are rowdy! It's also great at night. The crowd is unpretentious and I always have a great time when I bring people here.

Give Northstar a try; it's a nice departure from the tourist areas of North Beach.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I really like this little dive bar!  I have always had a great time here.  

Pool (check)
Juke Box (check)
Movie Popcorn (check)
Awesome beer (check)
Non-pretentious atmosphere (check)
author: Sarah F.

description:
Great place for anyone from or around Buffalo.....  They serve blue, and it feels like a lot of buffalo bars.

The crowd tends to be a good mix of mid 20s-30s and pretty chill.  It does get packed some nights but well worth it.

Fellas, buying any female a blue who is not from buffalo is not a good way to pick them up.... trust me.
author: lars H.

description:
I was very indifferent about this place.  Indifferent about the booze, the folks and the area.  

It was just one big "whatevs" accompanied by a shoulder shrug.  

Maybe I just wasn't in the mood to drink?   Shit...how'd that happen?  Is Satan putting on a sweater down in Hell?
author: Jay H.

description:
The only other bar I trust other than the Tee Off Shanghai Kelly's (that's assumed) and The Buc to serve me stiff drinks and understand what being a bar is all about. I commend them for the great happy hour and free pool.

I would give them five stars but Frank scares me and the popcorn machine is gone.

EDIT- Popcorn machine is back! Fred is GONE. FIVE STARS
author: Allan R.

description:
By far my favorite North Beach Drinking establishment.    Lots of friendly people, free pool (except on Thurs, and Sat) and popcorn.  While it would be nice if they sold cans of PBR, $3 drafts isn't too shabby.  It's also the only bar in the City that serves Labatt Blue (for those who hail from the Great White North).  For people who want a loud rauckus bar go on Saturday nights or Sunday Mornings (they happen to serve the lovely patrons of Buffalo).  For those who are looking for something more low key, it's great on any other night.   

While I wouldn't quite classify it as an oldman bar, it has many of the same benefits  without all the homeless people.  These include being able to bring in your dog, and you can bring in outside food.

The bartenders are nice and accomodating, and the bar is laid out well enough so that you shouldn't have trouble getting a drink.
author: Patrick C.

description: I came here with friends to watch the World Cup Final.  It was a sad day for USA Women's Soccer but the bar was cool.  There were plenty of TVs and it was a very chilled environment.  We sat at one of the booths in the back and had a great view of the screen.  I had a Bloody Mary, a shot of Jameson and a Stella while I was there.  The Bloody Mary was nothing to brag about and as for the shot of Jameson, well, I really should have known better.  The Stella was good (obviously) and the prices were reasonable.  This may become one of my go to bars for sports!
author: Dana G.

description:
So, they used to have a popcorn machine which would warrant 5 stars since access to these buttery morsels of goodness has been known to sway my good opinions to gross extremes.  I learned last night that the popcorn was attracting rats who were chewing through the electrical wiring, so until they get their doors sealed there will be no popcorn.  Booooo.  

That said, there were a ridiculous number of dudes there and $1 Buds until 9:30.  I'm presuming the Buds attract the guys and the guys attract the Buds.  

There's a pool table, semi-adequate seating, and a relatively good beer selection.  The bathrooms are tiny, though.  I have a feeling I will frequent this place again when it's the guys' night to choose.
author: Nicole A.

description: A no-nonsense, down-to-earth neighborhood bar that makes SF feel like Chicago or Minneapolis. Bring your friends, stay for hours, get there early, go back every day next week.
author: Megan G.

description: For the locals of North Beach: This is the neighborhood watering hole! Cool bouncer/bartender. Fair size spot with pool table and great beer selection --- Poppy Jasper on tap folks!!!
author: Lisa R.

description: Northstar Cafe was kind of on my walk home from work.  We had many great work related happy hours here... big fan like ellyk E.  We used to live together, work together and frequent this old neighborhood divy but hip corner joint.
author: Shiho F.

description:
Neighborhood gem.  That pretty much sums up everything the Northstar is.  It's just far enough off the beaten path that it's not a tourist trap and is frequented by locals.  It gets pretty crowded on the weekends, but hey, you can't keep this place a secret forever, right?  Besides, people who complain about a bar being crowded probably would have more fun sitting at home talking to their cats.  

The bartenders are among the friendliest you'll find in the city.  The drinks are reasonably priced, if not downright cheap (for SF at least).  Hell, they even let me DJ on the back porch every once in a while.  What's not to love about this place?!?  Northstar, I dedicate my liver and disposable income to you!
author: Norm U.

description: What can I say, this is my favorite bar, its a Buffalo Backers Bar, so they will always show Buffalo games, even if they don't have one on, just ask, and they'll quickly oblige. I'm sure everyone has said it here, but the bartenders are really great, and one of the owners Mark is amazing, they do a lot of fundraiser events, have parties, do pub crawls, get buses and tickets for sporting events. This bar is truly active and loves its regulars. I have been going to NS since 2006, and I don't see myself letting up anytime soon. So grab a shot of fernette and have fun!
author: Christopher F.

description:
I can't even stand to be in here anymore.

Last time I was there a bunch of frat guys (I think literally active fraternity members) were stomping their feet in time to Johnny Cash's Ring of Fire and encouraging the rest of the bar to "stomp it up"

I left...college pukes.

On weekdays when it doesn't get the USF undregrad crowd it's a solid "quasi-dive"
author: Jay W.

description: My long Island Iced tea was good, but cost $9. The set-up was ok ($.25 Pac Man, but a more challenging than normal version)  -- filled with striped shirt frat boys and desperate young ladies. Whities galore. Not good.
author: Andrew K.

description: Smallish. Not bad not good. Teeny tiniest female bathroom in the world, def not accessible. Few tvs and seemingly ok price on booze. Yee ha.
author: Meg S.

description:
Wednesday through Saturday night frat party from hell. One star.

Tuesday nights of bartender Erin's mai tais and G-Love's "Cold Beverage" on the jukebox. Five stars.

Annoying location. One star. 

Naked lady art. Five stars.

Three stars.
author: Megan W.

description:
I have to give this place 5 stars for being my first bar ever in SF.  When I was 18.  Thank you for thinking that I was 32!

You started me on a long and happy road.  For that.  I owe you thanks....
author: Thadd L.

description: This is my neighborhood Cheers!  I love this bar, the bartenders, the people who come here, the free pool, the free popcorn and their awesome drink specials they have during the week!  They show all the sports that are on that day and they have a huge fan base according to what sport is on.  You can hear screams coming from this place when their team scores!  The juke box is awesome as well!
author: Limzer L.

description: Awesome neighborhood bar with a great crowd and better staff.  Scheduled a birthday party there recently and couldn't have been happier.  The owner Mark was great about getting the section reserved and calling ahead of time to confirm the details.  Bartnenders Molly and Christian took great care of us throughout the night and even helped setup/decorate - cannot thank them both enough!
author: Arthur H.

description:
When I moved to SF right after college, my friends and I used to spend every Friday and Saturday night at Northstar. Utter craziness and debauchery. Lots of single people. Lots of drunk people. Lots of mornings regretting the happenings of the night before.

All in all, it was a good time. The staff is awesome (big shout-out to Hooks), they make a mean Cosmo, random "famous" people are always there (sports people, crazy reality show "stars"), you can always meet new people (their quality is questionable however), and no one cares if you're wild and crazy and silly.

I'm older and wiser now, so I haven't been back in a very long time. But I'll always have fond memories of my time spent at Northstar.
author: Ava S.

description: It was pretty chill; me and my co-worker who was asking for the impossible (a pina colada in a little bar) one Friday evening when the city was on the brink of winter. We were talking about flat screen televisions when all of a sudden a bunch of people wearing silly Birthday hats skipped in and from that point on, all we were saying was "HUH?" and "WHAT??" From that point on people were doing what they were supposed to be doing: having a great time with their buddies. Me and the co-worker were a little miserable, even after three drinks. We really only stayed because we had to fulfill the $20 min to use our credit card. We shoulda just stuck with Red Jacks.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I found a place that airs, Aussie Rules Football!!! One of the fast pace exciting sports to watch.... If only I lived in OZ I wouldn't get so excited about a bar showing a stupid football game. 

North Star has a lot of Character and the best bartenders in town!
author: Dee C.

description:
This is my sports bar.  I love to watch football games here, the bartenders are great, the drinks are strong, and the Bloody Mary's are some of the best out there.  Oh yeah, and there's popcorn too!  

And the most important thing... not too many a**holes go here to watch the games.  The crowd is a good natured for the most part and that makes screaming and yelling for your team even more fun.

Thanks guys!
author: Jessica B.

description: Sweet bar on the weekends.  Definitely my favorite bar in the city.  Free pool on the weekdays but amateurs need not to put their name on the board.
author: Jason D.

description:
This place kicks ass for the below reason. 
1) Good Internet juke box
2) Cheap drinks (extended happy hour)
3) Great service (bartenders are always attentive)
4) Nice TVs to watch sports games
5) Local crowed 
6) Extended happy hour (Rad enough to say twice)
If your just looks for a place to listen to some music, have a beer with a friend and watch a game this is the bar for you !
author: Sara F.

description:
This place has a great beer happy hour. $3 pints until 8 Sunday through Thursday.  Also a great place to watch a hockey or football game.  They play the sound of the game which is really awesome!

For the Sharks and Sabers they had free Hot Wings and a great time was had by all.  

This is a dive sports bar though so don't expect anything else.
author: Moe J.

description: Solid place. I don't go out in North Beach that often, but when I do this is probably my favorite destination. Earlier in the evening, it isn't too crowded, great vibe overall, a fun low-key scene. Past 10 or 11 it gets a little too crowded for my taste. Also, I couldn't help but notice the guy to girl ratio was about 10:1. This may or may not be a good thing depending on who you are, but I loved it!
author: Priya N.

description: randomly walked in off the street after a nice dinner looking for some laid back fun and found it here. Came on a sunday night and the bar had some drink specials, fresh popcorn and large TVs ready to go.  It even came equipped with drunkies, a couple of people shooting pool and an overall diverse crowd. The bartender Mark was especially funny/nice and kept our drinks coming the whole time we were there. I would def come back if I'm around the area again
author: Mary N.

description: Like the bar...but a grey goose and sprite is $10. Ouch.
author: Helen V.

description:
Great spot to meet up with old buddies, have a few beers & shoot pool.

I remember this was one of the only places in North Beach that used to go off on Thursday nights, but that was a long time ago.

Only downside is how small (& sometimes stinky) their bathrooms were.
author: John Eric S.

description:
If you're anything like me, you like to start drinking early in the day.  Take my advice and head on over to Northstar. 

Happy Hour starts at 1:30 AND they have what is quite possibly the best jukebox in the City, if not the world.

I once popped in at the commencement of Happy Hour and what was on the TV but John Paul Jones jammin' Zeppelin tunes on a pedal steel with a hella clean back up band.  That's not the kind of thing one comes across too very often. It's also exactly the type of thing that a middle-aged suburban white boy like myself can truly appreciate.

And the cast of characters at that time of day!  I once unwittingly settled a high stakes bet (I believe it was $40, if memory serves) between an extremely interesting group of fellows regarding the definition of the word "ennui".  Glory was fleeting however, as moments later I was humiliated by the same bunch when asked to spell "hors d' ouvres". (My excuse? "Hors d' ouvres" can't be used in Scrabble.)  It must have been Bastille Day or something.

And of course it's always great to hear about Ed the bartender's most recent career choice and the latest fisticuffs in which he has been involved.

Did I mention the free pool and (delicious) popcorn?

Q:  Does it get any better than this?  

A:  No.  No it does not.
author: Jimmy J.

description: First - who knew that there was a 'cafe' after Northstar? Though, i have been here on a weekend afternoon and had coffee as my beverage of choice, but that really isn't a typical northstar outing in my book. I come for the great vibe, jukebox selection, pool table and popcorn. The bartenders are great, and the whole bar is just a fun place to come before or after anything, or on a 'just because' kind of night. I love this bar, definitely a favorite.
author: Natalie J.

description:
The few things I miss about my hometown are as follows:

1) My folks
2) Chicken wings (you call them Buffalo Wings)
3) Cheering the Buffalo Bills and Buffalo Sabres as they invariably snatch defeat from the jaws of victory in dramatic fashion.

Well, here in SF, #3 is my only option, and I can take care of that at the North Star while drinking $3 Labatt's in the company of those who understand what I mean when I say "The Bills are hot and the beers are cold."
author: Suo L.

description:
I came here like five times without even realizing what the name of the place was. Finally this weekend I found out the name of the place was Northstar. Every time I've been here it's been incredibly crowded and full of drunken ex frat boys. I think this may be where you go when you finally realize that you're too old for Bar None. 
Plus one because the bartenders are pretty nice.
author: Cathy T.

description:
I had a friend in town who happens to be a fireman and wanted a t-shirt from the fire house in china town.  Unfortunately they were out on a run when we stopped by, so we wandered down the street to grab a drink until we tried again...

We stumbled on Northstar, basically because the doors were wide open and the music coming from the jukebox was fun.  As soon as we sat down, we made friends.  Partially because I ran into people I work with, but also because the bartenders and other patrons were super friendly!!  We ended up staying longer than planned, headed back to the firehouse, got a t-shirt and went back to have some more fun!!  It was a great way to start the night ($3 beers for happy hour) and more than likely a nice place to be later on also.  

If it weren't for me moving in 3 weeks, I would definitely be making this a regular stop in my bar scene.  Enjoy!
author: Emily M.

description:
First of all, how can a place so chill and so laid back charge $3.50 for the champagne of beer...MILLER HIGHLIFES?  Bus Stop is $2.00 and R Bar I think is $2.50 (but they have Olympia's in cans for $2.00 so you can't go wrong there).  Then they offer their drafts for $3.00 during happy hour?  I think I'd rather pay the extra $.50 for the happy tummy the next day as my trust in peoples taps and cleanliness lately has been diminished entirely.

Other then that and the nasty smell of cleaning supplies, dried up and fresh urine, old dirty guys' B.O., and the strange first impression attitude from the bartender, this place is "A-OK" with me.  I mean really...it's ain't that bad.  At least they always have plenty of TP in the women's bathroom in a nice pretty basket waiting for you!  Plus the patrons aren't so bad.  I mean, they all look like normal peeps rather then done up, made up, fake ass, pretenders.  

I have been an occasional Northstar drinker, nothing consistent, but I don't mind catching a game, chatting with friends, or dancing and singing to the wonders of Boys Gone Wild whenever they make an appearance back in SF.
author: Ayrn H.

description:
I really like Northstar ... it's fun because it usually gets pretty crowded and lively on a Saturday night.  It's small, but there is still a room in the back to play pool and a little porch-like area where people can sit and watch. 

I can see why this bar would be perfect to watch a game in, and apparently the happy hour is great too.

Definitely a solid four stars for this neighborhood bar... very fun!
author: Sophie D.

description:
Always a good go to.  Good sports bar, friendly bartenders, cheap drinks.

Also ladies, there is a picture of Joe Montana laying in a pool in the 80s and he's pretty much naked...pretty hot.  Reason enough to go right there.  The bathrooms are kinda yucky though.

Honestly, I don't have much to say about Northstar, just that I love it and I'm here a lot.  Keep up the good work.
author: Angela S.

description: It doesn't get any better than the Northstar. Good people, pool, popcorn, all things Buffalo. My brother lives around the corner and I will be visiting for the weekend and look forward to spending my share of time at the NStar.
author: Molly M.

description: My favorite neibarhood bar. They have free pool and popcorn, happy hour drinks , and the bar stuff is really really friendly.
author: Teo B.

description: #1 favorite bar in San Francisco - nay - the WORLD. The greatest combination you can get of low key, nothing fancy atmosphere, cheap good beer selection, lots of space, places to sit if you want, free pool, free popcorn, decent jukebox selection, and a great crowd - no cheesies allowed.
author: Meg M.

description:
LABATT LABATT LABATT!!!  The only place where they play Bills games on Sundays during football season as well.  Plus they let you bring in outside food.  What better way to spend a Sunday during football season - get drunk, get breakfast food, watch the Bills game and get drunker!

Park in the garage around the corner on Vallejo next to the police station - not a bad price!
author: Lauren R.

description:
I can't even tell you how wonderful these guys are, everyone from the staff to the owners, every single one of them are as sweet as pie and more than willing to lend a helping had (or grab you a drink :). It's true, there are no yuppies or popped collars here, but that's what makes this place go great; its come as you are and you will always be treated like a king/queen. 

I first heard about this place from a friend when I began my fundraising for Team in Training. I was so overwhelmed and didn't really know what to do or how to raise the $2100 I had promised to the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. Prior to calling Northstar I had just had a Happy Hour at a newly opened cupcake shop. At the cupcake shop fundraiser we packed in about 50 people and everyone was drinking, eating, and ordering up a storm. I was guessing by the sheer numbers (even the owner said that they hadn't had that many people in the shop since they had opened, which was months ago). that I would get a hefty donation. Not so much. They gave me $50 and called it a day. Super disappointing! So, I gave Northstar a call and set up a Happy Hour. In four hours I raised a couple hundred dollars. It was AMAZING, especially since I only really had about 10 of my guests show up. I couldn't be happier with Northstar and will always give them my business and refer them to anyone looking for a great spot to hang out and have a beer (esp fundraisers!!!)
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Friendly bartenders, cozy atmosphere, cheap drinks, free pool and popcorn. A bit divey, but thats where it gets its appeal.
author: C B.

description: I love Northstar!  Some people here say it's a dive bar but it's really nice and cozy in there.  Great local feel where the bartenders know your name and your favorite drink.  I don't think it's divey at all.  It gets kind of loud during the weekends but the bartenders are all nice, it's clean, there's free popcorn, and best of all, they make the best cosmos!  Cheers!!!
author: Deborah V.

description:
found this place on yelp when looking for a good happy hour place. and this one has the latest happy hour (til 8pm)...took us FOREVER to find parking...so the late happy hour was perfect for us...

It's a really chill place with cheap drinks...i think draft was $3 during happy hour...we had 9 beers and it was only about 40 total? they played good music, the crowd seems really cool...and apparently they have free pool and popcorn during happy hour...wouldn't mind going back again whenever I'm in the area!
author: Jenny C.

description:
On the weekend this place will be packed with a bunch of yahoos, so if you're into that kind of crowd and don't mind not being able to hear your friend whose standing right next to you, then this is your place. 
It's great for a watching football on a Sunday afternoon, not too busy then
What I love about this place can be summed up in one word. Sub. Sub is hands down my favorite bartender. He make the best bloody mary I've ever had. Always a nice guy. All the staff here are.
author: Josh H.

description: I can't remember much by the time I got here, but that must mean it was sensational. It definitely had beersies.
author: Michael B.

description: Great Bar!! Love the fun atmosphere and partying to the  jukebox. Young and chill crowd - I'm definitely coming back for another night of drinks at this dive :)
author: Caroline J.

description: hand down the best bar staff in sf, you could not get a better group of guys to set the mood for a bar. on top of that they have free pool, free popcorn, and they are a bills bar with a really fun group of regulars and events throughout the year. all around fun, easy going bar to watch a game or hang out at. see you there :)
author: Barbara C.

description: By far the best bar in North Beach. Best bartenders (Sub, Mark, etc.) but the people that go there are cool too. Great for watching sports during the week, and a fun crowd on he weekends.
author: PierLuigi G.

description: My friend and I held a fundraiser at Northstar last night for Team in Training and it was AMAZING!  The staff, especially Mark, could not have been more helpful, friendly, and supportive.  We were treated like old friends and we were able to raise a lot of money for a great cause!  A huge thank you to the Northstar!  We will definitely be coming back for the great atmosphere, staff, and of course the cans of PBR!
author: Rachel W.

description: Great local bar in a great location. I live nearby have a great time eveytime I go! Northstar is low key, lots of TVs and pool table in the back. They have reasonably priced drinks, good crowd and a great staff. The owners and staff are extremely welcoming and make it feel like a small town bar in the middle of a big city! I definitely recommend Northstar to anyone who is looking for a place to go in North Beach!
author: Leila V.

description: Great happy hour. It lasts forever and it includes hot buttered popcorn. You can find me here quite frequently, except when the hardcore pool players take over the back room and get weird. If you bring your pool stick to happy hour, you came for the wrong reason.
author: Kathleen E.

description: i usually stop in here when i've been over at o'reilleys (across the way) just to see who's hanging out. a nice little NB bar and very laid back. Usually a local crowd and more cute guys than any girl could ever need in just one bar. small and casual bar. Good place to watch sports too.
author: Michelle I.

description: THE place to tip a few before dining in NB ! this is our absolut (vodka) fav stop before going to North Beach Restaurant, Wash B & G, et. al. when the Gold Spike closed I didn't think we would frequent the Northstar as much, but we def do. what's not to like, the boys are cuuuute, boyfriend talks sports with the barkeeps (snore), and I can people-watch as the location is grand -- this corner is prime real estate. always friendly and not pretentious in the least. but we do avoid the late-night Friday/Saturday crowd . . . why in the world would I want Bud spilled all over my designer stilettos ?!
author: Prima D.

description: As others have said, this place is often packed with cute young guys. It's not the place to go if you're looking for a gem of a conversation, but it's laid back and the bartenders know what's up.
author: Caitlin E.

description: This is the perfect place to go if you're one of those  girls who thinks that true love can be found in a crowded, beer-soaked bar in North Beach on a Saturday night.  For those of you who are always asking your girlfriends, "so where are all the single guys in San Francisco, anyhow?"... let me tell you something, they're hanging out at the North Star Cafe.  Young and old, hipster and preppy, drunk and drunker, if you're looking to take home some digits (or, for the more adventuresome gal, the guy himself), it's like shooting fish in a barrel.  Oh, and the jukebox rocks.
author: Katie C.

description: This would be a full on 5 star if i could ever remember leaving this place.  Seriously.  The only downside is that it gets freakin packed in there.  The crowd is surprisingly non-homogeneous, and hammered.  Good times if you don't want the typical NB scene....
author: Robert R.

description:
Bar, plain and simple. They serve booze and you drink it.

Place is usually packed on weekend nights, but push your way to the back. Somewhat near the pool tables and oddly painted, fake deck and you got some room. Just be mindfull of those playing pull or you might get an ass full of pool stick. 

Place attracts the standard crowd, nothing special and no need for some dumb dress code. Bathrooms are easy to get to and very small. 

Caution you can easily see into the bathrooms (*warning women*), so do not expect privacy from drunk men or women. Well that is what my friend told me!

Kind of place where you can kick back, very limited seating. And enjoy a classy Bud Light in the bootle or vodka tonic. Floor can get sticky from whatever combination of fluids (booze, saliva, etc.). ALmost to sticky, but hey it is fun to stick to bar floors!
author: David B.

description: Northstar is one of the few places in North Beach where there is a distinct lack of the B&T crowd that populates the bars and clubs on Broadway. That being said, the crowd does tend to be fairly yuppie-ish in that  "look at me, I work at an I-bank" post-collegiate sort of way, but if you get there early enough and snag the little patio section by the pool table, you and your bros can drink there in peace. Bathrooms suck though.
author: Chris B.

description: Even though it gets packed, for some reason the circulation of this bar seems to work.  The bartenders are efficient and friendly, music is fun and the crowd is friendly.
author: ellyk E.

description: I hate to be one of those people who say things like "I remember when..." about places in San Francisco but I remember when North Star was a true dive bar back when Kaitie O used to live around the corner.  We would go there on a weekend night and play songs on the juke box and sometimes even pour our own drinks.  Over the last few years it has somehow turned into the cool dive bar and it's usually crowded and smells like old popcorn.  We went here last night after dinner and all of the girls looked like girls who want to hang out in the Marina but don't have the self esteem to do so and, as a result, say they "prefer" dive bars instead.
author: Steven M.

description: Good drinks, good price, good people. My girlfriend and I visited the Bay Area for a week because we're trying to decide if we want to move there. If we make the move, North Star will be one of our regular spots. On our first day in SF, we walked in for happy hour. The bartender was hilarious and served me up a whiskey/coke for 2 or 3 bucks. We started talking to a few local folks and they were incredibly friendly and gracious--they actually wrote out a list of other bars and restaurants to check out that aren't at touristy. Unfortunately due to some crazy circumstances, never made it to see Curtis at the Pologrounds before the Giants game--next time, man.
author: Nate G.

description: Came here already drunk, but it was totally great! Nice considering it's 4 blocks from my house and a pretty good low key crowd that is not fratty marinaish but not hipster missionish either.
author: Krystha B.

description: I shudder with feelings of skeeziness upon contemplating the frat-party gone horribly wrong that is Northstar. I'm by no means anti-dive bar, but there had better be some compelling features to offset the grunge factor and Norhtstar just doesn't offer any redeeming qualities. The room in the back with the pool table is pretty cramped, if you're looking for a game or a place to sit down. The place has got a funk that's just not kosher and the night that I had to step over yakkage to get to the ladies room explained a lot of that. There are so many places to get a cheap beer in this city, I just wouldn't want any of my friends to waste their time here.
author: Greenballoon X.

description: I'm not a big fan of Sports Bars, but this one had a good crowd for a Saturday -- ie. lot's of friendly people having a great time.  Plus, they were smart enough to have a decent bartender to drinker ratio which meant that I didn't have to wait very long to get attention, despite how crowded it was.  That made for a good experience, as did the strong drinks.
author: Akshay S.

description: Northstar is by far my favorite local bar. They have a great happy hour M-F and provide free pool and popcorn. It is also a great place to watch sporting events, especially if you are a Buffalo Bills or Sabres fan. Sunday mornings get crazy with Labatt drinking Bills fans spilling out of the bar. You can literally hear the crowd all over North Beach when the Bills score. Overall Northstar is everything you could want in a neighborhood bar... Great staff, great drinks and a fun crowd.
author: Mark B.

description: Good neighborhood North Beach bar.  It's a few blocks away from the more popular haunts, so the crowd is more local.  It can get pretty packed, but not in the annoying way that other North Beach spots do.
author: Andrew E.

description: I don't usually like North Beach, but this bar is great.  Good happy hour, plenty of flat screens and a great juke box.  I hear it gets pretty crowded just like any other bar in town
author: Corey V.

description: I have to agree with the other reviews on this one. Feels like a good ol' Midwestern bar with that type of crowd. Not too pretentious, just here for drinkin'. Just the kind of bar I like. Nothing special to this place, definitely no frills, but the bartenders are good and the music ain't bad. If I get dragged along up to North Beach, this is my preference.
author: Michael E.

description: Best bar in the city. Period.
author: Ferol G.

description: The corner bar is always a great place to have a beer while you are doing your laundry and watching the NCAA basketball tournament  . I tend to stay away on the weekends, but during the week you never know what you will find at the Northstar...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I like this place for being a bar-type bar.  The first night I moved to my neighborhood I came here in my sweat pants and sweatshirt, and felt totally comfortable.  That being said, I have showed up here after a nice dinner, and felt uncomfortable being so dressed up.  I do agree with Katie H., lots of single guys and a beer-soaked bar.
author: Lindsay T.

description: I basically lived in the Northstar for the summer of '03...and looking back, it's a glorious haze. Cheap beer, popcorn, solid juke box, Mrs. Pac Man (Pizza-Hut sit down style for you 80's revival folks), a pool table, and laugh out loud pictures in the men's bathroom...oh yeah, and the crowd is usually pretty rowdy and good looking. Get invovled.
author: Mike P.

description: Okay, this is how I am starting off my review, Haha!  The bartender, I think was a hot tranny.  I was definitely jealous of her boobs, but any who.  I love the North Beach crowd.  They just seem real, and not your hipster, Marina, folky or wannabe crowd.  Just good ol' jeans and t-shirt crowd.  Its a full bar with pool tables in the back.  Popcorn machine and jukebox in the front and just a fun spot to hang with friends and good company.  Plus its on the same block as Beach Blanket Babylon so you get to watch the street performers dazzle the viewers standing in the ticket line.  You're also not far from an Irish pub, sports bar, brewery and diner.  Its a neighborhood, that guess what, i grew up at and hated.  I lived right across the street, above Capp's diner, and was annoyed with party animals, people passed out with vomit on my stairway and just craziness.  But I was a kid, and now that I'm older and wiser. . . .I LOVE IT HERE!  What was I thinking. . . duh Janice, its awesome.  So check it out. . .you might fall for it too.
author: Janice F.

description: It's a great lil dive bar.  I've been there a couple times and walk by it almost everyday.  It's fun!
author: Noneya B.

description: Ahhh, the Northstar, my favorite neighborhood bar.  The bartenders are awesome and you never have to wait for drinks.  Always a fun crowd at the Northstar!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Drinks are SOLID and so are the bartenders so I'll rate this place  4 stars although I haven't sampled the cuisine.  It's always a good sign when local restaurant servers, bartenders, managers, etc. frequent a locale and that's what Northstar is.  The place where the local "help" goes to help themselves.  I fully enjoyed my cider (Wydmer's) and shots and found their bathrooms clean as well.  Not certain about meals but the bartenders were cheery to the bitter end, and since I was my usual cracked out self, I appreciated it.
author: Jill D.

description:
Expect a good-sized crowd on Thursday nights, and on weekends. The prices for PBR and other selections are good, and they keep icecubes in the pint glasses for that frosty cold feel. Nothing worse than holding a lukewarm (or worse, just out of the dishwasher) glass.

The music they play is a good selection, last night they played pretty much every song on the Cure's "Disintegration" cd, and it just set the mood, such a great album. Nothing's better than being at a bar and noticing that others around you are enjoying the music, too. 

Later, those same people kept it going on the dancefloor in back to the beats dropped by one of the resident DJs. 

Minus one star for my experience here on St Patty's day, it was just too packed. 

I got one drink, and then I had my bag of booze confiscated by the SFPD. Probably went into their after-hours pig roast or something, ha.
author: Alex G.

description: A great bar when you're looking for that local dive feel.  Takes me back to my college dive where everyone knew my name.  Crowd is actually hit or miss in my opinion.  Drinks are strong enough and cheap enough.  Love the doorman, especially on the slow weeknight when he let my friend bring his dog in.
author: Emily M.

description: Northstar is a bar.  It serves drinks and plays music.  Don't touch the bug zapper in the back corner of the bar.
author: Jonathan M.

description: it's so nice to know there's a cozy place near work with a fun selection of cheap drink specials! a great place to just hang out, watch some sports and enjoy free popcorn and pool!
author: Andrey C.

description: This is my favorite bar in San Francisco. Great for coming during the day and having a drink and free popcorn. I have some friends that only come for the popcorn. Sometimes on Friday and Saturday it can get a little packed, but the best times are on Thursday nights and after work where you can just hang out and be in a dive bar without the dive people. Love chatting it up with the bartenders there, they all have great stories. Find myself going there by myself when I just want to chill out and have a beer. The owners are great too.
author: Megan P.

description:
Greatest Bar Ever! The drinks are strong, the happy hour is long, and the bartenders are the greatest. I am a huge fan of this bar. On Sunday's it turns into the local Buffalo Bill's bar haven and the blue is flowing strong. They have free pool and popcorn and lots of memorabilia all over.

If you need a local place to hang out... this is the place to go.
author: Jax C.

description: This actually feels like two joints in one.  Up front it's a crowded lame dive bar, but in the back there's this elevated area with small tables, one of which is a pac-man table.  That's the place to be while waiting your turn at pool.
author: Rego S.

description: This place is a good spot.  It is a no frills bar, with lots of TV's, a great juke box. Free pool most of the time, and free popcorn. The bar tenders are great dudes, they make good drinks, great happy hour from 1-8 every day 3 dollar pints and well drinks. They play lots of soccer, and hockey and a good place to chill with friends. Not mega babes hanging out but good girls and just a good spot to get drink any night of the week. You can get good and drunk here. It is a good time. They also have all packages so you can ask them to turn on your game if you got it like that.
author: peter v.

description: 3 1/2 stars really.  This was one of the very first bars I hung out at when I first moved to San Fran and lived on Green Street. Just a great neighborhood bar that can draw a cool crowd and make a good night even better.  A good place to start or end your night if you're hitting up North Beach.
author: Laura H.

description:
wasnt impressed with anything here. they do have a popcorn machine on one side of the bar, which delivers wafts of that theatre-butter smell - i.e. vomit. 

mix of people here from white haired locals, striped-shirt frat boys, and your 30 something drunk making comments on the canucks' logo color scheme.

if its your local bar, go to - drink it up, but no reason to go out of your way to be here.
author: Darrell L.

description: I came here on Oct. 28th after going to the niner game. Came to watch the world series, nice TV's for a dive bar I must say. I had a good time here. Free Popcorn and Pool. :) + the bartender was fast and courteous and not bad looking either. Good beer on tap. I would definitely come here again. Cheers!
author: Lorraine B.

description:
I didn't have as good an experience here as others, maybe because we were looking for somewhere else, but then i recalled reading reviews about good bloodies so we stopped in...it was midnightish (we JUST left, and i'm sober enough to write a review, if thats an indication...but with only one drink i suppose that's ok..), after going out elsewhere since 9ish, and they were having some $4 flavored vodka specials (which obviously i didnt expect to be strong, but it wasnt bad...not something i'd order if not on special though)...it was totally divey as other reviews state, and maybe tonite was just a bad night, but it was an older, somewhat rude crowd (some guy came up to my boyfriend asking if hed 'seen his coat'--he must have been sitting there earlier--and when my boyfriend said no, but then found it on the floor the older man was like 'you knocked it onto the floor didnt you.' not in a kidding way, but in a rude way...which no, he didnt..)
i would come back here for daytime bloodies (especially as ive yet to try one here and i love north beach!), but i dont think i'd come back for another night experience....
but again, from other reviews, i'm hoping this was just a bad night!
author: Danielle J.

description: Pulled pork contest there yesterday = free food (by local chefs). Can't miss their John Daly concoction, sweet tea vodka + Odwalla lemonade, almost healthy drinking. Def worth the trek to North Beach.
author: Rhianna M.

description: I must say I'm luck y that this is my local watering hole but sometimes the crowd is just too much.  Like say for last Thurdsay when the spillover from O'Reilleys was a bit overwhelming (That's my guess based on the Irish lads hitting on me and my friends).  But mid-week is a calmer, more pleasurable experience.
author: Mara H.

description: One of the best bars in the city.  Don't go unless you want to really step on the gas because you will just get annoyed.  But always a good crowd and they are a red sox bar which is a bonus.
author: Michael N.

description: This place is a great neighborhood joint. Every time I'm in here the bartenders are incredible, Even if I can't understand them(Sub and Ellsy). Free popcorn, pool, and entertainment from Hooks for happy hour!
author: Tommy W.

description: Good for a large group. Gets crowded on the weekends (what do you expect with bars). If you're holding a party there they let you bring your own food! Flat screen tvs with sports playing in the background and a pool table in the back room. Not bad..
author: Yosie G.

description:
Wow, Northstar Cafe, eh?  That's a pretty generous use of the term "cafe."  Or is beer really a food group nowadays?

Northstar gets my five stars because the owner has been gracious enough to let my friend's charity organization host fundraisers here.  "Gracious" might not be the word I'm looking for, considering that I'm sure the events brought in a decent chunk of change for the Northstar, but still.  He's a do-gooder in my book.

(Oh, and Miranda M is spot-on when she writes that the girl-to-guy ratio is good--if you're a girl.)
author: Hannah J.

description: Great dive bar if you like that sort of thing...lost one start for the inability to play any music on the jukebox (even though it will take your money..no one ver hears their song) but cheap, casual night with a tolerable crowd.
author: Jess W.

description: This place is great.  I went to the OPD fundraising event where all the money from drinks went to the OPD Memorial Fund. The fund was established by Deputy Sheriffs' Association of Alameda County after four Oakland police officers were killed in the line of duty.
author: johnny t.

description: Awesome place! fun bar to hang out with buddies and make new friends, the bartenders know what is up and are great,  plus free popcorn!
author: Jen S.

description: This is the first bar I went to when I moved to San Francisco.  Good sports crowd always watching a game.  It's a nice little neighborhood bar for sure.
author: Nate V.

description: I like this place during the day on Saturday or Sunday. It's a great place to lounge, nurse a hang over, bring your own food (and dog if you like), and just watch sports. Total dive bar, and I can't quite understand how this place gets so packed at night, but it does. I would give it five if this place didn't resemble a solid brick of frat boys on Saturday night.
author: Tim Y.

description: This place is great during the day. You can do whatever. Saturday nights get pretty rowdy and there are always more guys than girls. Go on off nights and they are usually the best nights. Its a good place to watch sports. I watched the bball playoffs here last year and it was grrrreaaaat! Warriors beating the MAVS!! Good times. Alot of interesting and diverse people comin in and out of this place. Just Saturday nights get a little Fratty.
author: Ash D.

description: and on to the Star. we were stopping by to see if Sub was working. not sure if he was or not, but he was there.  fernet should be banned but is always passed out here.  very easy to meet people - friendly place provided you are just out to have a good time.  one friend met an austrian lad who followed us from here on out...
author: Mike B.

description: I must admit that I LOVE the Northstar - great bartenders, hot ones!  I love Ed and Seb makes an awesome Bloody Mary.  A great drinking bar, guaranteed that you will get hammered when you come here.  The drinks are strong and the bartenders will buy you one if you are there for a while - that's the way it should be!  Better to come during the week than on the weekend when the Marina crowd invades.  A great place to watch sports, especially on a Sunday afternoon.  One of the best bars in the City!  Unfortunately I am not the only one who thinks so however.
author: Kristina M.

description: 5 stars for convenience (I see you!), and for the good peeps.  Happy hour is looooooong (1-8, M-F) and a stellar deal ($3 wells and drafts).  On the weekends during the day the place is a total pickle jar, it's like someone ripped the needle off the record the way all the heads turn when a girl walks in (I like sports too).  On the weekend nights it's a busy spot, and full of North Beach restaurant industry types.  The bartenders are friendly and pour a fair shot.  I have met some good people and some bad hangovers as a result of this spot, which bills itself as the home of "drinking consultants since 1883".  Try their bloody mary, it's top drawer.  The "cafe" part of their name is a misnomer, unless you count the free popcorn.  The Northstar overall is a great little neighborhood booze mill.
author: Amanda B.

description: okay i will admit that there isnt really anything special about this bar, and sometimes its way too crowded, but i have had a lot of fun times here with my friends!  sometimes too fun... still dont know how i lost my wallet in the mensroom that time.  anyway, its just a great bar to hang out in, definitely try out the jukebox, its always fun to hear your  songs come on.
author: Carolyn B.

description: Just popped in for a quick pre-show drink as I was dragged to Beach Blanket on a Sunday when the place was booze-free.  It seems like a really great neighborhood bar.
author: Korla M.

description: ehh. a busy, semi-trendy, dive bar - with a college-feeling, old-frat-kid, kinda-yuppy-crowd.
author: Today Y.

description: Best sports bar in the city. Really knowledgeable bartenders who know their sports. Go there enough and they'll remember your name and wont even hassle to check your ID, which is always nice. This was my neighborhood spot for several years.
author: Tom F.

description: i've been here now three or four times on friday nights, but for whatever reasons, northstar doesn't get crowded. i suppose this is a good thing cuz north beach can get quite obnoxious on weekends. hence if you're in north beach, especially on weekends, leave the rowdiness to broadway and columbus and head to northstar. grab a drink and be thankful that northstar hasn't been discovered by the weekend crowd. i think you know what i'm talking about.
author: frisco j.

description: My favorite neighborhood destination (except on Friday and Saturday nights, when it fills with the young weekend party crowd).  On weeknights and earlier on weekends, it's just a great casual spot where locals gather to have a beer and watch sports.  The bartenders are very friendly, and a lot of fun.
author: Grace R.

description: really great place to hang out in...cute guys...pool table...good drinks...can get a little crowded but that's all good...usually the place i end up at after a long night and i wanna hook up
author: Stephanie J.

description:
the women's bathroom here is RIDICULOUSLY small!  i used the men's bathroom as well (as the single stall for the girls was taking way too long) and I'm appalled that the men's is actually bigger than the women's!

I went on a friday night and the place got packed, with all-american fraternity/sorority types drunkenly trying to make passes at each other (knocking me over in the process).  still, had a good time and the bartender made a pretty strong kamikaze...
author: jozilla w.

description: I think it's only appropriate that my first review is of northstar, since i can usually be found there at least once a week!  It's a great local bar with free popcorn, free pool and a jukebox.  Love going there on off nights and agree that friday nights can be kinda fratish.  Mark the bartender is the best!!
author: Orla P.

description: it's small, it's packed, it's fun. they serve alcohol too (wait this is a bar review - that's good right?).
author: Patrick D.

description: i like sundays @ the 'star'. easy to get a pool table, relaxed time.
author: linn c.

description: Great bar to relax at early in the evening.  It tends to get too crowded later at night.  Claims the be the Buffalo Sports bar of  SF with its Bills and Sabers items on the wall.
author: Steve H.

description: Cheap beer, popcorn, free pool, awesome....favorite bar in the whole city...go there!
author: J M.

description: One of the best bars in No Beach and may be in the city.  Gets a local crowd due to the fact it's off Columbus.  Not real stuffy and you usually end seeing someone you know in there.  Good spot to either start, stay, or finish up at.
author: Eric G.

description: Best bar in the city and possibly the entire West coast....maybe even the world.
author: Ryan T.

description: 4 years ago this would have been a 5 star place (God I am getting old), but then it became popular.  Good luck getting a beer or a game of pool, but if you want to come in and try, power to you.  It is still a pretty fun place to hang out...good music and the crowd gets pretty rowdy as the night moves on...
author: Matt A.

description: how can anyone live in russian hill not like the northstar cafe.
author: Miss O.
